question_sentence: What is the historic probability of Delaware having at least an inch of snow on the ground on Christmas, based on United States climate normals from 1991-2020?
What was the focus of the latest referendum for the Appoquinimink School District?
Latest analysis by Reporters Without Borders (RSF) found that which country ranks lowest for press freedom?
evidence: The analysis of press freedom in 180 countries and territories put the hermit kingdom in last place on the annual World Press Freedom Index, followed by Vietnam and China. Norway topped the ranking for the seventh year in a row.

question_sentence: Which state is adding more homeless people every year than any other state in the US?
evidence: Half of all Americans living outside on the streets live in California. More than 170,000 unhoused people currently live in the state — and that figure is growing, federal data shows.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden designated a new national monument this week surrounding which popular tourist destination?
evidence: President Joe Biden on Tuesday designated the fifth national monument of his presidency and unveiled new climate resilience funding for national parks during a visit to lands surrounding one of the seven natural wonders of the world, the Grand Canyon.

question_sentence: A nine-month world cruise operated by which company has been dubbed TikTok's favourite new "reality show"?
evidence: Since the operator's Ultimate World Cruise set sail from Miami on 10 December, TikTok has been flooded with posts tracking activity and potential dramas on the cruise ship, called Serenade of the Seas. The hashtag #ultimateworldcruise has now had hundreds of millions of views on the social media platform.

question_sentence: Rishi Sunak has faced scrutiny as a subject of how many investigations or probes in the past year?
evidence: The prime minister is under investigation by Parliament’s sleaze watchdog over allegations of a possible failure to declare shares held by his wife in a childcare agency boosted by the recent Budget. Sunak has also faced scrutiny over issues including his wife’s non-dom tax status, his US green card and his dog-walking habits.

question_sentence: Which cryptocurrency saw a 20% jump over the past week?
evidence: Bitcoin is surging again, topping $35,000 for the first time since May 2022. It’s up 20% over the past week.

question_sentence: A sample from the surface of near-Earth asteroid Bennu has been found to contain an abundance of what?
evidence: The initial findings on the 4.5 billion-year-old asteroid sample, which was parachuted into the Utah desert in a cannister last month, reinforce the theory that life on Earth was seeded from outer space. Offering a first look at the ancient black dust and chunks, Nasa administrator Bill Nelson told media at the Johnson Space Center in Houston that "this is the biggest carbon-rich asteroid sample ever returned to Earth”.

question_sentence: The Metropolitan Police has launched an investigation after several items were found to have been “missing, stolen or damaged” from which major museum?
evidence: After “what is believed to be the largest breach of security in a decade”, said The Times, the British Museum announced yesterday that an employee has been dismissed and will face legal action. No arrests have yet been made and the museum is conducting an independent review into what happened. “The irreplaceable items” that were “taken from the vaults” include gold jewellery, semi-precious gemstones and glass dating from the 15th-century BC to the 19th-century AD, said The Telegraph.

question_sentence: Which country this week announced the sale of military equipment to Armenia amid escalating tensions in the Caucasus?
evidence: The agreement to sell military equipment such as air defence systems to Armenia was announced amid growing fears of a possible invasion by Azerbaijan.The neighbouring Caucasus nation's recent seizure of the semi-autonomous Nagorno-Karabakh enclave "accelerated” the willingness of France – which is home to Europe's largest Armenian community – to “deepen military ties” with Armenia, said Politico.

question_sentence: What is the significance of the term "blue moon" in astronomy?
choices: A blue moon refers to a moon that appears blue in color due to atmospheric conditions.
A blue moon is the first full moon of the year, signifying the start of a new lunar cycle.
A blue moon is the second full moon of a month or the fifth full moon of a season.
A blue moon is a term used to describe a moon that is particularly bright and larger than usual.

question_sentence: A life-sized chocolate sculpture of King Charles III was unveiled this week to celebrate which upcoming occasion?
evidence: A chocolate sculpture weighing more than 50 pounds was unveiled by a confectionery brand to mark King Charles III’s coronation on May 6 in London’s Westminster Abbey.

question_sentence: What type of eco-friendly funeral option is becoming available in the UK this year?
evidence: The alternative to traditional cremation and burial will become the UK’s first new legal method of corpse disposal since the Cremation Act of 1902. The process involves dissolving a body in a bag in 160C water treated with an alkali and has a lower carbon footprint than gas-fired cremation.

question_sentence: What is the reason behind Rite Aid’s bankruptcy filing?
choices: Lawsuits alleging it contributed to the U.S. opioid epidemic

question_sentence: Secretary of State Antony Blinken traveled to which country this week in an effort to “stabilize” relations?
evidence: Blinken traveled to China for meetings with top officials, including President Xi Jinping. Blinken is the first US secretary of state to visit Beijing in five years, and his talks were seen as a key litmus test for whether the two governments can stop relations from continuing to deteriorate at a time of lingering distrust.

question_sentence: Which unusual flavour of Easter egg will be launched by Deliveroo, the food delivery app, in time for Easter weekend?
evidence: According to the Daily Star, the “somewhat baffling treat” is available in cities across the UK over the weekend via the Deliveroo app. “Love fried chicken? Love chocolate? Then put your hands together,” said Aisha Jefferson from Deliveroo.

question_sentence: What percentage of UK adults believe that refugees make a “positive contribution” to society, according to an Ipsos survey?
evidence: The survey of 22,000 adults in 29 countries found that Brits had the third most positive attitude to refugees, after Spain and New Zealand. The global average of adults who believe refugees make a “positive contribution” was 45%.

question_sentence: The federal government's COVID-19 national public health emergency formally came to an end this week. When was it first declared?
Regulators seized First Republic Bank and sold all of its deposits and most of its assets to which institution?
Which US political figure set off a social media frenzy after sharing details about an experience with “magic mushrooms?”
evidence: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen confirmed in a CNN interview this week that she ate a dish at a restaurant that contained “magic mushrooms” on a recent trip to Beijing, but was unaware the mushrooms had hallucinogenic properties.

question_sentence: By what percentage have incidents of shoplifting risen in the year to September, according to the Office for National Statistics?
evidence: Luton Town’s win means the team will return to the top division for the first time since 1992, a season before the Premier League was created.

question_sentence: Red Bull driver Max Verstappen ended this year's F1 season with a record 19th Grand Prix victory where?
evidence: The Belgian-Dutch driver's win at the season finale on Sunday gave him an 86.4% win rate in this year's 22 F1 races. Verstappen has broken his own record of 15 wins last year, which smashed the previous record of 13 by Sebastian Vettel and Michael Schumacher.

question_sentence: Rock & Roll Hall of Fame icon Tina Turner died this week at 83. Which one of these was not one of her songs?
choices: "What’s Love Got to Do With It"
"To Know Him Is to Love Him"

question_sentence: While many US industries have recovered from the Covid-19 pandemic, which major sector still has a huge shortage of workers?
evidence: The leisure and hospitality industry is struggling to recover all the workers it lost due to the pandemic, recent data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics shows. This sector has the biggest shortage of workers, down 349,000 people, or 2% of the total pre-pandemic workforce.

question_sentence: The daughter of late NHS fundraiser Captain Sir Tom Moore was ordered to demolish what unauthorised structure in her garden?
evidence: Hannah Ingram-Moore and her husband were granted permission to build an office in the grounds of their Bedfordshire home, to be used partly “in connection with the Captain Tom Foundation and its charitable objectives”, but then added a pool building and applied for retrospective permission. They have now been ordered to demolish the pool spa complex after the retrospective application was denied.

question_sentence: Why is Fort Delaware known to be such an eerie place according to Daryl Marston from "Ghost Hunters"?
choices: Its haunted reputation comes from World War II ghost stories.
The fortress is located on an island.
It was a prisoner of war camp with a high death toll from the Battle of Gettysburg.
It is famous for hosting historical re-enactments.

question_sentence: Former US diplomat Manuel Rocha is accused of being an undercover agent for more than 40 years for which country?
evidence: Colombia-born Rocha, a former ambassador to Bolivia, served as a "clandestine agent" of Cuba throughout his 20-year career in the State Department and the following two decades, the Justice Department said in charges unsealed on Monday. He was arrested last week following a long-running FBI investigation, and if convicted currently faces up to 10 years in prison, but more charges were expected to be filed.

question_sentence: A pair of basketball shoes worn by which athlete recently became the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction?
evidence: Michael Jordan’s iconic 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sold for a record $2.2 million.

question_sentence: Archaeologists recently unearthed the oldest known structure in the world. Which material was it made of?
evidence: This simple wooden structure found along a riverbank in Zambia is almost half a million years old, researchers say.

question_sentence: The FBI this week said people should avoid using which public technology?
evidence: The FBI warned people against using public phone charging stations in order to avoid exposing their devices to malicious software.

question_sentence: Which soccer team was shockingly knocked out of the Women’s World Cup this week?
evidence: Germany, the two-time champion team, was dramatically knocked out of the World Cup on Thursday after a 1-1 draw with South Korea.

question_sentence: Fireworks are a common sight in the summer night sky. Which country is considered to be the birthplace of fireworks?
evidence: Most historians credit China with the invention of fireworks around 800 AD. But it was in the 1830s that Italian inventors added trace amounts of metals to the mix and created the colorful displays that dazzle us now.

question_sentence: What did the NAACP call for in response to the officer-involved shooting of Tremaine Jackson?
choices: Greater police transparency and the release of video footage
Increased funding for police body cameras
The immediate arrest of the officers involved

question_sentence: Who is permitted to be on the Community Advisory Group for the contaminated East Basin Road Groundwater Superfund site in New Castle?
choices: Residents who reside near the site

question_sentence: Which country said it will ban smoking on beaches and in public parks?
evidence: France will ban smoking on beaches and in public parks as the country’s government aims to create a “tobacco-free generation by 2032,” the country’s health minister said this week.

question_sentence: Who is starring as The Nutcracker in the Wilmington Ballet’s 56th annual production of “The Nutcracker”?
What happened to the three Dover High School football players in the car crash near Felton?
choices: They were arrested for reckless driving.
They were uninjured in the crash.
They were charged with criminally negligent homicide.
They were critically injured in the crash.

question_sentence: Which athlete shattered the women's marathon record last Sunday in Berlin while wearing new £400 "super shoes"?
evidence: Ethiopia's Assefa crossed the line in two hours, 11 minutes and 53 seconds, knocking more than two minutes off the previous record set by Kenya's Brigid Kosgei in 2019. Only 48 hours later, Adidas put the Adizero Adios Pro Evo 1 trainers on the market – only for the stock to sell out within hours.

question_sentence: What is the name of the first wine released by Elena Delle Donne’s brand, Deldon Wines?
The Miami Heat eliminated the Boston Celtics to punch a ticket to the NBA Finals. Miami is the first No. 8 seed to advance this far since the:
The US opened an embassy this week in which Pacific island nation?
evidence: The US opened an embassy in the Pacific island nation of Tonga on Tuesday, Washington’s latest move to broaden its diplomatic footprint in a region where China has been increasing its influence in recent years.

question_sentence: What was the headline in The News Journal that referred to the wild fir tree growing from a crack in Philadelphia Pike?
What was one of the key issues mentioned in the lawsuit against Regal Builders LLC?
choices: Lack of resident participation in governing boards

question_sentence: A new study found that which UK city is the “gloomiest” in the UK?
evidence: Research by Betway found that the West Yorkshire city was the least sunny in the UK, followed by. Blackpool and Aberdeen.

question_sentence: Which Spanish city hosted the third European Political Community summit?
evidence: Some 50 European leaders gathered on Thursday for informal talks aimed at fostering cooperation, with Ukraine's application for EU membership high on the agenda.

question_sentence: The total number of women on this year’s Booker Prize shortlist is fewer than the tally of male nominees who share which first name?
evidence: Paul Harding, Paul Lynch and Paul Murray are among six authors nominated for Britain’s top literary prize. Jonathan Escoffery is also a finalist, with only two women on the shortlist, Sarah Bernstein and Chetna Maroo.

question_sentence: Months after Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas came under scrutiny for accepting lavish trips paid for by a billionaire Republican donor, another justice is in the spotlight for similar reasons. Which justice is it?
evidence: Concerns about ethics and transparency at the Supreme Court have been reignited this week after Justice Samuel Alito acknowledged attending a luxury fishing trip on the private jet of a conservative hedge fund manager.

question_sentence: Which automaker reached a tentative agreement with unionized workers to end a bruising strike?
evidence: More than 16,000 autoworkers are set to return to their jobs after the United Auto Workers union and Ford reached a tentative deal to end a strike.

question_sentence: Which Thanksgiving dish was invented in the 1950s by a Campbell Soup Company employee named Dorcas Reilly with the hope of boosting sales of one of Campbell’s products?
evidence: Reilly invented the “Green Bean Bake,” as it was first called, as a new way to use Campbell’s Cream of Mushroom soup. It wasn’t originally intended as a Thanksgiving favorite, but it quickly became one.

question_sentence: Which Republican candidate dropped out of the 2024 US presidential race last weekend?
evidence: After languishing at the bottom of the polls and struggling to raise money for his campaign, the former vice president suspended his bid for the top job, announcing at the annual Republican Jewish Coalition convention: "It's become clear to me it's not my time."

question_sentence: Revellers pelted each other with more than 10,000kg of what food at a festival in the Colombian town of Sutamarchán?
evidence: The Gran Tomatina festival celebrates the end of the harvest season. The annual food fight was cancelled during the pandemic but returned for a 15th staging on Sunday.

question_sentence: What is the name of the cheese dubbed the "world's smelliest" set to cause a stink in UK supermarkets?
evidence: The brie-style cheese, available in some Asda stores this Christmas, has an "exotic aroma" of "old feet", according to makers Highland Fine Cheeses. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to The Week's Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which airline hit the headlines after charging an elderly couple £110 to print new boarding passes?
evidence: Ruth Jaffe, 79, and her husband Peter, 80, were forced to pay the fee after they “accidentally downloaded their return boarding passes instead of the outgoing ones for a flight to France”, reported The Guardian. The couple told BBC Radio 4’s “Today” programme that the airline’s “confusing” website design had led to the error. Find out more on this week’s episode of The Week Unwrapped.

question_sentence: Travelers through what city experienced major travel delays after a tanker truck fire caused an elevated portion of I-95 to collapse?
Which pop singer released a concert film that set a record at the box office?
evidence: Taylor Swift’s concert movie brought in about $96 million, making it the highest-grossing concert film domestically for an opening weekend, according to AMC.

question_sentence: Which company was sued by dozens of states this week for allegedly harming young users’ mental health?
evidence: Dozens of states sued Instagram-parent Meta on Tuesday, alleging that its designs — such as infinite news feeds and frequent notifications — have contributed to a mental health crisis in the US.

question_sentence: Workers in which country arrived at work to find a national holiday had been declared overnight?
evidence: The Latvian parliament met at midnight to declare a national holiday after the country’s ice hockey team won a bronze medal at the world championships.

question_sentence: Medical experts have criticised a new TikTok trend showing parents doing what with eggs?
choices: Daring teenagers to swallow them whole
evidence: The videos, many of which use the hashtag #eggprank, are getting millions of views, but many of the children look “upset and stunned”, said Sky News. Medical experts have also warned of the risk of salmonella.

question_sentence: What is the current estimated population of adult Atlantic sturgeon breeding in the Delaware River?
Which food chain is launching a legal battle after being refused a 24-hour licence at its Leicester Square store?
evidence: The British bakery chain is set for a courtroom showdown with Westminster Council after being denied permission  to sell hot food at its flagship London outlet after 11pm..The application was rejected last year after police warned that selling late-night sausage rolls risked fuelling “crime and disorder”.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled nearly 2 million vehicles this week due to a fire risk?
evidence: Toyota recalled more than 1.8 million RAV4 vehicles. At issue is a fire risk from some replacement batteries, Toyota said in a statement.

question_sentence: When the weather warms up it’s time for a cookout! How many hot dogs do Americans consume each year?
evidence: According to estimates from National Hot Dog & Sausage Council, Americans consume as many as 20 billion hot dogs per year. That number factors in retail sales (9 billion), as well as hot dogs eaten at sporting events, local picnics and carnivals.

question_sentence: What subject does Cory Hafer, the 2024 Delaware Teacher of the Year, teach at Middletown High School?
Which popular European travel destination is seeing triple-digit temperatures that recently left several tourists incapacitated due to heat stroke?
evidence: In Italy, an intensifying heat wave has already claimed at least one life and left several tourists in Rome incapacitated due to heat stroke, officials said.

question_sentence: Three astronauts returned to Earth this week after how many days in space?
evidence: The crew, an American and two Russians, had prepared to spend 180 days in space, but their original return capsule was hit by space junk while docked to the International Space Station. The resulting coolant leak was only discovered about three months after the crew had left Earth, in December 2022.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden’s dog, Commander, has been involved in several biting incidents, according to the US Secret Service. Which breed of dog is Commander?
evidence: The 22-month-old German Shepherd is receiving new training after White House personnel raised concerns about safety on the premises.

question_sentence: Which city was enveloped in a blanket of toxic smog this week?
evidence: A toxic haze in the Indian capital of New Delhi reached hazardous levels for several consecutive days this week. The airborne particle pollution reached PM 2.5 — a concentration nearly 80 times the World Health Organization’s recommended limit.

question_sentence: FDA advisers this week voted unanimously in support of making which type of medication available over-the-counter for the first time in the US?
evidence: Advisers for the FDA voted unanimously on Wednesday in support of making a birth-control pill named Opill available over-the-counter, saying the benefits outweigh the risks.

question_sentence: Which fruit crop in Georgia has been severely impacted by extreme winter weather?
evidence: The Peach State lost 90% of its staple fruit crop this year after abnormally warm winter weather and a late-season freeze, researchers say.

question_sentence: Which popular series is getting a reality show spinoff?
evidence: A reality competition show based on the wildly popular series “Squid Game” will stream on Netflix next month. According to an official synopsis, the series follows 456 contestants who “enter the competition show in pursuit of a life-changing reward of USD $4.56 million.”

question_sentence: What is the name of the BBC's controversial new drama about Jimmy Savile?
evidence: The four-part drama stars Steve Coogan as the serial sex predator and examines how Savile got away with his crimes. Coogan is being praised for his performance, but some critics have questioned the purpose of the dramatisation, which premiered on BBC One and iPlayer on Monday.

question_sentence: Taylor Swift attended which NFL match amid rumours of a new romance?
choices: Kansas City Chiefs vs. Chicago Bears
New York Jets vs. New England Patriots
evidence: Swift watched the Chiefs crush the Bears on Sunday from the private box of Chiefs player Travis Kelce, whom she is rumoured to be dating. This coming-together of "two of the biggest cultural phenomena" in the US "possibly brought in a whole new group of fans" to the NFL, said Fox News.

question_sentence: Which university is in search of a new president following a firestorm of controversy?
evidence: Harvard president Claudine Gay announced her resignation Tuesday following weeks of criticism over the school’s response to antisemitic incidents as well as an ongoing plagiarism scandal.

question_sentence: Residents in Washington, DC, were startled by a loud sound this week. What caused the boom heard throughout the capital city?
evidence: Military jets were “authorized to travel at supersonic speeds” as they raced to make contact with an unresponsive aircraft flying in the region that later crashed in a heavily wooded area. The extraordinary speed of the jets caused a sonic boom across the Washington, DC, area that confused many residents.

question_sentence: Which heavily trafficked website wants to do away with passwords and pivot to an alternative sign-in method known as “passkeys?”
evidence: Google is rolling out “passkeys, ” a technology that prompts users to unlock their accounts with a fingerprint, face scan or pin number to provide an added layer of security against potential hackers.

question_sentence: Who became the UK's sixth health secretary since the 2019 elections?
evidence: The former criminal barrister was appointed as Steve Barclay's successor during Rishi Sunak's cabinet reshuffle on Monday. Atkins previously served as financial secretary to the Treasury.

question_sentence: Which state was sued by the Biden administration this week over a controversial immigration law?
evidence: The Biden administration on Wednesday sued Texas over its controversial immigration law that gives local law enforcement the authority to arrest migrants, arguing the state “cannot run its own immigration system.”

question_sentence: Which state is investigating robotaxi collisions after a handful of incidents recently endangered pedestrians?
evidence: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration and California investigators have opened a probe into whether General Motors’ self-driving vehicles are safe around pedestrians.

question_sentence: How many mobile phone thefts were reported in London last year?
evidence: Newly released Metropolitan Police data has revealed that an average of 248 phone thefts a day were reported in 2022 in the English capital. The boroughs with the most thefts were Westminster (25,899), Camden (7,892), Southwark (5,690) and Hackney (4,618).

question_sentence: Man City’s 2-1 victory over Man Utd last weekend brought the Sky Blue’s total tally of FA Cup title wins to how many?
evidence: The latest victory puts Man City joint with Aston Villa for total FA Cup title wins. The record for the most wins is held be Arsenal, at 14, followed by Man Utd (12), and Chelsea, Liverpool and Tottenham (all on 8).

question_sentence: What is one of the changes that Delaware Park's $10 million renovation project includes?
choices: Renovating the racetrack and sports betting areas
Adding a new area for high-limit table games
Closing down the casino during renovations
Reducing the number of slot machines

question_sentence: What did a student in South Korea do to a banana that was part of an art installation worth over $100k?
What item is being sent by the UK government to New Zealand and Australia as a goodwill gesture marking the start of two new post-Brexit deals?
evidence: As the agreements between the UK and Australia, as well as the UK and New Zealand, took effect this week, various items were exchanged as goodwill gestures. Beano comics, signed by the comic’s editor, along with Penderyn single malt Welsh whisky, Brighton Gin, bags from the Cambridge Satchel Co, and Fever-Tree mixers were sent to both nations.

question_sentence: What does the data from the Delaware Department of Education show about student proficiency in the years following the COVID-19 crisis?
choices: Student proficiency has significantly increased across all subjects compared to pre-pandemic levels.
Student proficiency remains the same as pre-pandemic levels across all subjects.
Student proficiency has slightly decreased across all subjects compared to pre-pandemic levels.
Student proficiency has varied across subjects, with some improvements and some declines compared to pre-pandemic levels.

question_sentence: Which French stadium will host the final of the men’s Rugby World Cup?
evidence: The tournament opens today when hosts France play three-times winners New Zealand at Stade de France on the outskirts of Paris, which will also host the final on 28 October. For predictions and odds, read our in-depth guide to this year’s tournament.

question_sentence: Which awards show announced its 2024 nominees this week?
evidence: The nominees for the 81st Golden Globe Awards were announced Monday, but it appears the show’s organizers are having a hard time finding someone to host.

question_sentence: Which prominent Fox News host parted ways with the company this week?
Which public figure will plead guilty to federal tax charges?
evidence: Hunter Biden, the son of President Joe Biden, will plead guilty to two tax misdemeanors and struck a deal with federal prosecutors to resolve a felony gun charge, the Justice Department said Tuesday in court filings. As part of the plea agreement, the DOJ has agreed to recommend a sentence of probation for the two counts of failing to pay taxes in a timely matter for the years 2017 and 2018, according to sources.

question_sentence: Which celebrity donated $1 million to residents in tornado-ravaged Tennessee?
evidence: The singer-songwriter donated to the Tennessee Emergency Response Fund after deadly tornadoes ripped through the region last weekend. "Nashville is my home and the fact that so many people have lost their homes and so much more in Middle Tennessee is devastating to me," Swift said on Instagram.

question_sentence: Hundreds of foreigners were allowed to leave Gaza this week for the first time since the Israel-Hamas war began. To which country did they flee?
evidence: Injured Palestinians and hundreds of foreign nationals have started crossing from Gaza into Egypt, officials and Egyptian media said, in the first sanctioned exodus from the besieged enclave in weeks.

question_sentence: Who ended Max Verstappen’s 10-race winning streak by claiming victory at the Singapore Grand Prix?
evidence: The Spanish racing ace claimed victory for Ferrari by narrowly beating his close friend and former McLaren teammate Norris to the finish line in the streets of Singapore on Sunday. Verstappen trailed in fifth position, behind Leclerc and Hamilton.

question_sentence: What percentage of Australian voters submitted "No" ballots in the country's Indigenous Voice referendum last Saturday?
evidence: Australians voted by a clear majority to reject plans to give Indigenous people more political rights. Groups on both sides of the debate have called for "a period of national unity and reflection while the dust settles" following the vote. For more international news, sign up to our free Global Digest newsletter.

question_sentence: The United Nations commemorated World Refugee Day on Tuesday. According to UN estimates, approximately how many refugees are there worldwide?
evidence: The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees estimates the number of refugees worldwide is approaching 35 million people — although that number does not include the millions of forcibly displaced people who have not been granted refugee status.

question_sentence: The Boston Bruins had a stunning exit from the NHL playoffs after setting the regular season record for the most:
Disney this week stopped selling what in Australia?
evidence: Disney has ceased releasing its films or TV shows on physical media formats in Australia, following a steep decline in sales of DVDs, Blu-rays and the like as streaming services become increasingly popular.

question_sentence: Which type of event placed millions of Americans under severe weather alerts across the central and eastern US this week?
evidence: Parts of the central and eastern US were slammed by a winter storm that knocked out power to hundreds of thousands of people and caused dangerous travel conditions.

question_sentence: What beverage was once popular and synonymous with Juneteenth celebrations?
evidence: Arriving on the heels of spring, Juneteenth festivities typically involve picnics, with red foods and drinks like strawberry soda dominating those spreads. The color red is believed to represent the blood shed by enslaved African ancestors.

question_sentence: Pat Sajak announced this week that after next season, he will step down as host of which game show?
Sports Illustrated CEO Ross Levinsohn was fired after the magazine was accused of what?
evidence: Levinsohn was fired weeks after tech website Futurism reported that Sports Illustrated had published several articles with fake author names and headshots from an AI-generated image website. The content was removed from the magazine's website, but published The Arena Group disputed the report's accuracy and said this week that Levinsohn had been sacked to "improve the operational efficiency and revenue of the company".

question_sentence: Which animal recently escaped from a circus near Rome?
evidence: A lion that escaped from a traveling circus near Rome was recaptured after several hours on the loose.

question_sentence: Which new security feature is to be trialled at Las Vegas Harry Reid International Airport?
evidence: Similar to supermarket self-checkouts, the new system allows travellers to "use passenger and carry-on screening systems at individual consoles or screening lanes themselves, reducing the number of pat-downs and bag inspections", said Dr John Fortune of America's national "Screening at Speed Program", which aims to make security screening faster and more efficient. Select passengers will trial the system at the Las Vegas airport from this month.

question_sentence: Which national leader claimed the UN was “losing credibility” as the intergovernmental organisation’s annual assembly kicked off in New York City?
evidence: Ireland's president took aim at the UN as political leaders including his taoiseach, Leo Varadkar, gathered in New York for the organisation’s 2023 General Assembly. The annual event got under way on Tuesday with an address from Joe Biden, but the leaders of the other four veto-wielding, permanent members of the UN Security Council – Britain, France, Russia and China – were conspicuously absent.

question_sentence: Which music legend turned 80 this week?
evidence: The Rolling Stones frontman celebrated his 80th birthday, on 26 July, with a star-studded party in London.

question_sentence: By what percentage will Delmarva Power decrease its supply charges for gas customers beginning in November?
What material is the Delrin acetal homopolymer product line, recently sold by DuPont, commonly used for?
Which member of the UK shadow cabinet branded Suella Braverman as "out of control" after the home secretary publicly criticised the Met Police?
evidence: Braverman claimed in an op-ed for The Times that there was a "perception" of senior officers in the London police force "playing favourites with protesters". In a tweeted response, shadow home secretary Cooper criticised the "highly irresponsible and dangerous attempt to undermine respect for the police during a sensitive time".

question_sentence: A total of 22 states raised their minimum wage this week. Which state now has the highest minimum wage?
evidence: The highest state minimum wage in 2024 is Washington state‘s, at $16.28 — up from $15.74.

question_sentence: Scientists have discovered that the females of which species fake their own deaths to avoid unwanted male advances?
evidence: German scientists reported that in tests, about a third of female frogs “clasped by a male” showed signs of “tonic immobility” – stiffening with arms and legs outstretched as if playing dead. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: How many Republican candidates participated in the presidential debate this week?
evidence: Five presidential candidates met the criteria to participate in Wednesday’s third primary debate in Miami. Former President Trump, the party’s front-runner, skipped the debate.

question_sentence: Which singer-songwriter got an on-stage spooky surprise when a keyboard began playing by itself during a gig?
evidence: The chart-topper was visibly shaken when her keyboard began playing notes by itself during the Era Tour show in Massachusetts. Swift subsequently explained that the seemingly possessed instrument had malfunctioned after being damaged by rain during a previous concert.

question_sentence: Which sources have been used to track Delaware gas prices and help people find the lowest prices?
choices: Weather forecasts and local news stations

question_sentence: Which Hollywood star has become a father again at the age of 79?
evidence: The actor revealed this week that he and his girlfriend, martial arts instructor Tiffany Chen, were celebrating the birth of their daughter, Gia Virginia Chen-De Niro. He has six other children, whose ages range in age from 11 to 51.

question_sentence: What is the main goal of the Melanated Mash Makers, a Delaware-based beer club formed by Black craft beer enthusiasts?
choices: To collaborate with breweries for special edition beers
To increase the presence of people of color in the Delaware craft beer world
To establish a brewery exclusively for Black craft beer enthusiasts

question_sentence: Jon Rahm won the biggest event in golf, The Masters, giving him how many major tournament wins in his career?
Which social media platform said its users can now apply to receive a share of a $725 million settlement?
evidence: Facebook users who had an active account between May 2007 and December 2022 can now apply for a share of the company’s $725 million settlement reached in a major data privacy scandal.

question_sentence: Which Supreme Court justice received sharp criticism for not disclosing luxury trips funded by a Republican megadonor?
evidence: Some Democrats have called for the impeachment of Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas following a bombshell report that detailed lavish trips paid for by a billionaire real estate magnate, which included traveling on his yacht and private jet.

question_sentence: The most powerful rocket ever built was launched this week – but its flight ended in a dramatic mid-air explosion. What was the rocket’s name?
evidence: SpaceX’s Starship, the most powerful rocket ever built, took off from a launch pad in South Texas on Thursday morning. However, the rocket exploded less than three minutes into its first test flight.

question_sentence: Which popular Christmas song topped the Billboard Hot 100 chart for the first time this week?
choices: “All I Want for Christmas Is You”
evidence: Sixty-five years after it was first released, “Rockin’ Around the Christmas Tree” has topped the Billboard Hot 100 for the first time. That makes the hit song’s original performer, Brenda Lee, now 78, one of the oldest artists to ever top the chart.

question_sentence: Which county in Delaware saw the most damage from the recent East Coast storm?
Which airline received a massive fine for keeping passengers waiting on planes during lengthy tarmac delays?
evidence: American Airlines received a $4.1 million fine from the Department of Transportation for extended tarmac delays that impacted thousands of travelers over the past few years.

question_sentence: What motivated the University of Delaware to join Conference USA?
choices: To enhance awareness of academic offerings and research initiatives
To form a new sports league
To establish a new indoor practice facility

question_sentence: More than 100 reports of hail were recorded in the South and Upper Midwest this week amid raging storms. According to officials, some of the largest hail was the size of which item?
evidence: In eastern Iowa, 4-inch hail – just larger than a softball – rained down on neighborhoods while some western suburbs of Chicago saw hail the size of baseballs.

question_sentence: What is the title of the new Banksy exhibition opening at Glasgow’s Gallery of Modern Art this weekend?
evidence: Banky’s first official solo exhibition in 14 years will feature stencils used to create many of the graffiti artist’s most iconic works from across his career.

question_sentence: Which government institution announced a code of conduct this week in an attempt to address ethics concerns?
evidence: The Supreme Court on Monday adopted a code of conduct. This comes after months of news stories alleging that conservative Justices Clarence Thomas and Samuel Alito accepted lavish gifts and took part in other controversial off-bench activities.

question_sentence: Who was sitting on the throne in England when the American colonies declared independence?
evidence: King George III is widely remembered for two things: losing the American colonies and going mad – although the former may be a bit unfair, as he did not develop the policies which led to the colonists’ war with England.

question_sentence: Which fast-food chain is upgrading its signature burgers?
evidence: McDonald’s, which has been focusing on upgrading its core items to boost sales, is rolling out a series of changes to improve its classic burgers.

question_sentence: How many people will get a universal basic income (UBI) of £1,600 a month in a proposed trial in England?
evidence: If the two-year pilot programme secures funding, volunteers to receive UBI will be selected at random from Jarrow in South Tyneside and East Finchley in north London, and 20% of places will be reserved for people with disabilities.

question_sentence: What is the title of Jodi Johnson's podcast, in which he shares his personal experiences and battles with mental health issues to spread awareness and provide self-help tips?
The CDC updated its recommendations on Covid-19 vaccines to allow another booster dose for people in which age group?
evidence: People who are 65 and older or those who have weakened immune systems and “want the option of added protection” are now allowed another booster dose, the CDC said this week.

question_sentence: What were the charges that Camden's former mayor, Justin T. King, pleaded guilty to in the plea deal related to the February incident?
Newly released Metropolitan Police figures show that one in every how many officers in the force are currently suspended or on restricted duties?
evidence: The Met has a total of around 34,000 officers, 201 of whom are suspended, while 860 are on restricted duties. The London force said that 450 officers were under investigation for alleged sexual or domestic violence, and that 275 were already awaiting gross misconduct hearings, amid a crackdown on rogue officers.

question_sentence: Which legendary music artist recently retired after touring for decades?
evidence: Elton John’s final tour came to an end with a performance in Stockholm, Sweden, this month. Listen to the heartfelt message he shared with his fans.

question_sentence: What new concept is Dick's Sporting Goods introducing in Delaware at the Brandywine Town Center?
What type of agreement was reached between dozens of countries this week?
evidence: The world agreed to a new climate deal in Dubai on Wednesday at the COP28 summit after two weeks of painstaking talks. The agreement marks the first time the annual UN meeting has asked countries to move away from fossil fuels — the main driver of the climate crisis.

question_sentence: Gregg Wallace presented what alleged food innovation to combat the cost-of-living crisis in a newly aired TV satire?
evidence: In Channel 4’s “Gregg Wallace: The British Miracle Meat”, the MasterChef co-host claimed to be visiting a company that sold “engineered human meat” grown from slices of flesh surgically harvested from real people. The mockumentary has sparked complaints to Ofcom from viewers who believed Wallace really was promoting human steaks as a way to combat the cost-of-living crisis.

question_sentence: Which country will become the first to label individual cigarettes with health warnings?
evidence: Canadian health officials say the new regulation to label every cigarette with a warning message is part of the country’s goal to drop nationwide tobacco use to less than 5% by 2035.

question_sentence: According to a newly published study, British parents increasingly view what as socially acceptable?
choices: Taking schoolchildren on holiday during term time
evidence: Research by Public First found that parental attitudes to school attendance had undergone a "seismic shift" since the pandemic. According to the consultancy firm, term-time holidays are increasingly viewed as "socially acceptable", as price hikes make summer breaks unaffordable for families hit by the cost-of-living crisis.

question_sentence: A top chef banned which diners from his Australian restaurant “for mental health reasons”?
evidence: Former “Great British Menu” star John Mountain, originally from Lancashire, posted a message on social media telling vegans to “f*** off”, after getting a negative review from a non-meat eater. On the Facebook page of his Perth restaurant, Fyre, he added that “all vegans are now banned”.

question_sentence: Which state deployed more than 200 law enforcement personnel this week to capture an escaped prisoner?
evidence: Convicted murderer Danelo Cavalcante escaped a Pennsylvania prison on August 31, sparking a dayslong manhunt. The search for him unnerved residents statewide who were warned that he was extremely dangerous.

question_sentence: Ford is recalling about 176,000 vehicles over difficult-to-reach seatbelts. Which model is being recalled?
evidence: The Ford Bronco is being recalled because people may get “discouraged” trying to use the seatbelts, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said.

question_sentence: Apple is widely expected to unveil the latest version of which product in the coming days?
evidence: The iPhone 15 and iPhone 15 Pro will likely be unveiled at a special event on September 12. Some of the rumored upgrades include new colors, better battery performance and a switch from Apple’s proprietary lightning connector to the USB-C.

question_sentence: Which retailer, known for its iconic blue-and-white 20% off coupons, will soon get rid of all its inventory in a liquidation sale?
evidence: Deal hunters are preparing themselves for Bed, Bath & Beyond’s mammoth going-out-of-business sale.

question_sentence: Which world leader met with President Joe Biden at the White House this week?
evidence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky made a trip to Washington on Tuesday to deliver an impassioned plea for more US aid to fight constant Russian bombardment.

question_sentence: What was the main reason behind Incyte's decision not to move forward with its headquarters expansion in Alapocas?
choices: Denial of critical variances by the New Castle County Board of Adjustment

question_sentence: Among the following Delaware charter schools, which one ranked highest in the U.S. News & World Report's "2023-2024 Best High Schools" ranking for charter schools nationwide?
According to new research, which biscuit is the most dunkable?
evidence: Researchers dunked 17 popular biscuits in cups of tea and recorded how many dunks each type survived before breaking apart. The Jaffa Cake was declared the winner – despite critics questioning whether it really is a biscuit – with 116 dunks, compared with the Digestive’s six.

question_sentence: True or false: With this week’s win in the NBA Finals, the Denver Nuggets claimed their first NBA championship.
Which England football player scored twice in Tuesday’s 6-1 win against China at the Women’s World Cup?
evidence: The Lionesses secured a place in the last 16 of the tournament, taking place in Australia and New Zealand, with goals by Chelsea forward James, Alessia Russo, Lauren Hemp, Chloe Kelly and Rachel Daly.

question_sentence: Which city was forced to close one of its busiest freeways due to a major fire?
evidence: A large fire forced the indefinite closure of a part of Interstate 10, one of the busiest traffic arteries in Los Angeles. The massive blaze was started intentionally, California Gov. Gavin Newsom said.

question_sentence: Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg filed a lawsuit against which politician over an inquiry into the prosecution of Donald Trump?
Memorial Day weekend is upon us. Which movie is considered to be the first summer blockbuster?
evidence: Released on June 20, 1975, “Jaws” went on to become the first film to gross more than $100 million at the box office.

question_sentence: Which state is now home to America’s highest gas prices, taking the crown from California?
evidence: The average cost of regular gasoline in Washington has jumped by more than 30 cents in the past month to more than $4.90 a gallon, according to AAA. Gas in California is nearly 10 cents cheaper.

question_sentence: Elon Musk told advertisers fleeing his social media platform X (formerly Twitter) to do what?
evidence: X and Tesla owner Musk overshadowed this week's release of his much-hyped Cybertruck by lashing out at major advertisers who have fled his social media platform over antisemitic content. During an interview at The New York Times DealBook conference on Wednesday, the billionaire claimed the boycott was going to "kill the company".

question_sentence: A bottle of Macallan 1926 whisky set a new auction record by selling for how much?
evidence: The rare bottle was expected to sell for a maximum of £1.2 million at the sale at Sotheby's in London on Saturday, but instead smashed the auction record for any bottle of spirit or wine. The previous record was set in 2019, when another of the total 40 bottles of the oldest-ever Macallan vintage sold for £1.5 million at Sotheby's.

question_sentence: Two baby owls found underneath the Pyramid Stage at this year’s Glastonbury have been named after members of which band?
evidence: The owls have been named Axl, after frontman Axl Rose, and Slash, in honour of the band’s guitarist, after being found under the stage during the band’s headline set at the festival. For more odd and unexpected news, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: How many alleged gang members have been jailed in El Salvador since a major crackdown on crime began in March last year?
evidence: President Nayib Bukele’s government has locked up a total of almost 2% of the country's adult population and has built a 40,000-capacity mega prison to accommodate suspected gang members.

question_sentence: What is the age requirement for students enrolling in the "Foundations of Brewing Science and Brewery Operations" course at the University of Delaware?
Who did Emmanuel Macron appoint as France's next prime minister?
evidence: The 34-year-old, who replaces Élisabeth Borne, is the youngest-ever and first openly gay prime minister in French history. Pundits have suggested that Macron chose Attal, previously education minister, in a bid to rejuvenate his flagging presidency.

question_sentence: What is the name of the latest Covid variant surging in the UK?
evidence: A descendant of the Omicron variant, EG.5.1 – nicknamed Eris by T. Ryan Gregory, a Canadian professor of biology – now accounts for one in seven new Covid cases in the UK. It is the second most prevalent variant after Arcturus, according to the UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA).

question_sentence: True or false: Connecticut lawmakers pardoned people who were accused, convicted and executed for witchcraft in the 1600s.
New York City’s new “rat czar” Kathleen Corradi previously worked as what?
evidence: Announcing the appointment, Mayor Eric Adams said former elementary school teacher Corradi “has the knowledge, drive, experience and energy to send rats packing and create a cleaner, more welcoming city for all New Yorkers”

question_sentence: What was the final score in last weekend's Premier League classic clash between Chelsea and Manchester City?
evidence: Chelsea's Cole Porter scored the equalising goal against his former club in a 95th-minute penalty, following a nail-biting clash at London's Stamford Bridge that saw City lead three times.

question_sentence: Memorial Day weekend is a great time to hit the beach. Which state is known as The Ocean State?
evidence: The Ocean State is the official nickname of Rhode Island. While the state is the smallest in the union, it boasts some 400 miles of shoreline.

question_sentence: What percentage of 16- to 18-year-olds believe the world is “likely” to end in their lifetimes because of climate change, according to a newly published poll?
evidence: Of more than 1,000 sixth-form pupils surveyed by think-tank Civitas, 26% also said that climate change had made their anxiety or sadness worse. And half said that people should have fewer children in order to tackle climate change and overpopulation.

question_sentence: A writers strike that began this week is impacting production on late night and scripted TV shows. How long has the union signaled that the work stoppage could last?
evidence: The Writers Guild of America, representing more than 11,000 members, has hinted that the work stoppage could last for many months. The last WGA strike ran for 100 days from 2007 to 2008.

question_sentence: Which organization secured $1 million from the Delaware General Assembly to purchase the historic Gibraltar mansion?
choices: The Delaware Department of Historic Preservation

question_sentence: Which of the following is NOT celebrated during official summer months?
evidence: May is National BBQ Month. July is National Blueberry Month, National Ice Cream Month and National Watermelon Month.

question_sentence: Under a new law passed this week, which state is now allowing drivers to pump their own gas?
evidence: Oregon drivers are now allowed to pump their own gas after the state lifted a 1951 ban aimed at preserving the jobs of service station attendants. This leaves New Jersey as the only state in the US where customers can’t pump their own fuel.

question_sentence: Sweden is building the world’s largest what?
evidence: The “world’s largest urban construction project in wood” will be built in Stockholm, announced Sweden, which could pave the way for similar structures in the future. Although the plan could be more sustainable than traditional construction, there are concerns about potential fire hazards. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which two teams won their matches on the first day of the Women’s World Cup football tournament?
evidence: Co-hosts New Zealand and Australia both kicked off their World Cup campaigns with 1-0 victories. New Zealand’s Football Ferns secured their first ever win on a global stage by beating Norway, while Australia’s Matildas broke a second-half deadlock with a decisive penalty against Republic of Ireland, who were playing at the tournament for the first time.

question_sentence: What is the total amount of funding that the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has awarded for electric school buses as of 2024?
The UK's new home secretary was accused of referring to which constituency as a "shithole"?
evidence: Following a question in the Commons about why child poverty rates in the County Durham constituency were so high, James Cleverly was allegedly heard saying: "Because it's a shithole." Cleverly subsequently claimed he had actually said Labour's Alex Cunningham, who asked the question, was a "shit MP".

question_sentence: A Canadian woman won the Cooper's Hill Cheese-Rolling and Wake in England after:
In what may be the largest cattle killing ever, how many cows died in an explosion and fire at a dairy farm in Texas?
What areas are being targeted for cell tower proposals in New Castle County?
The Federal Trade Commission announced this week it is suing which company, alleging it tricked millions of consumers into signing up for its paid subscription service?
evidence: The FTC is suing Amazon, alleging that the e-commerce giant has tricked millions of consumers into signing up for its Prime subscription service through deceptive user interface designs. The complaint also takes aim at Amazon for allegedly trying to keep users subscribed who wished to cancel their memberships.

question_sentence: Which bank encountered a technical issue that made some customers’ direct deposits disappear from their accounts?
evidence: Wells Fargo said it has resolved a glitch that made some customers unable to see recent check deposit transactions.

question_sentence: Candidates for the Republican presidential nomination headed to which campaign-opening state summer fair last weekend?
evidence: Donald Trump, his former vice-president Mike Pence and Florida governor Ron DeSantis kicked off their bids for the Republican presidential nomination at the state fair in Iowa last weekend. Although the caucuses are not until January, the Iowa State Fair is a “rite of passage for presidential candidates”, said John McCormick at The Wall Street Journal.

question_sentence: What was the final score of the basketball game between Princeton Tigers and Delaware Blue Hens?
What was the status of the Lahaina fire containment as of the evening of Aug. 14?
Which quarterback agreed this week to a five-year, $255 million deal, making them the highest paid player in NFL history?
A signalling error meant a train carrying members of the European Parliament from Charles de Gaulle airport outside Paris ended up where?
evidence: The special train chartered to take EU officials between the parliament's two seats in Brussels and Strasbourg took a wrong turn and ended up at Marne-la-Vallée, home of Disneyland Paris. The incident, said Politico, will do little to "deter those who deride the institution as a Mickey Mouse Parliament". Sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter for more odd news.

question_sentence: Michael Oher, the real-life subject of Oscar-winning film “The Blind Side”, has accused his adoptive parents Sean and Leigh Anne Tuohy of what?
choices: Concealing communication from his birth parents
Getting him to sign papers making them his conservators
Selling personal stories about his wife to the press
evidence: The ex-American football star has claimed that unlike in the Hollywood version of events, the Tuohys did not adopt Oher. Instead, they lied and got him to sign papers making them his conservators. The family has said they are “devastated” by the allegations, which they deny.

question_sentence: Which labor union ended a historic strike this week?
evidence: SAG-AFTRA, the union that represents about 160,000 actors, reached a tentative deal with Hollywood film and TV studios, ending a monthslong strike.

question_sentence: Why do ladybugs often enter houses during the fall and winter seasons?
choices: To look for a place to lay their eggs
To find food in human homes

question_sentence: Which medication is expected to substantially increase in price in the coming months?
evidence: The price of the lifesaving Covid-19 antiviral medication Paxlovid will more than double as the US transitions out of the emergency phase of the pandemic, drugmaker Pfizer said this week.

question_sentence: Saudi Arabian football club Al Hilal put in a record £259 million transfer bid for which French player?
evidence: The 24-year-old striker’s club Paris Saint-Germain reportedly gave the Saudi Pro League side permission to speak to him after receiving the offer, but French media claimed Mbappé had refused to enter negotiations. His contract with the French side is due to expire next June.

question_sentence: King Charles III ascended to the throne in England after the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II. His coronation ceremony was held at London’s Westminster Abbey. Who is next in line after King Charles?
evidence: King Charles III’s oldest son, Prince William, is the heir to the throne.

question_sentence: What type of health hazard is currently increasingly rapidly in the UK?
evidence: Pest control company Rentokil has reported a 65% year-on-year increase in bed-bug infestations. The rise has been attributed to the popularity of recycling furniture, as well as a resurgence of travel since the pandemic.

question_sentence: What are the symptoms of West Nile fever?
choices: Swollen lymph nodes, muscle weakness, and convulsions
Stiff neck, tremors, and rashes on the chest
High temperature, head and body aches, swollen lymph nodes, and rashes on the back or chest

question_sentence: Which retail chain recalled nearly 50,000 mattresses due to the risk of mold exposure?
evidence: Federal safety regulators said thousands of mattresses sold exclusively at Costco could have been exposed to water during the manufacturing process, potentially leading to health risks for consumers with weakened immune systems and mold allergies.

question_sentence: Netflix recently released a trailer for the second season of which hit show?
evidence: Netflix has shared exclusive new details for the second season of its runaway hit “Squid Game,” the South Korean thriller series in which contestants who are deeply in debt play children’s games in order to win a ton of cash — with the losers getting killed.

question_sentence: Which state is now home to America’s highest gas prices, taking the crown from California?
evidence: The average cost of regular gasoline in Washington has jumped by more than 30 cents in the past month to more than $4.90 a gallon, according to AAA. Gas in California is nearly 10 cents cheaper.

question_sentence: What is the theme for the White House holiday décor as unveiled by first lady Jill Biden?
choices: A Celebration of Diversity and Unity
The Magic, Wonder, and Joy of Childhood

question_sentence: Who was named Director of the Year at this week's Palm Springs International Film Festival Awards?
evidence: The "Barbie" director was presented with the Director of the Year award by her film's stars Margot Robbie and America Ferrera at the awards ceremony in Palm Springs, California. Other winners included actors Cillian Murphy, Emma Stone and Carey Mulligan.

question_sentence: Which airline will begin weighing some passengers before flights?
evidence: Passengers flying with Korean Air in the next few weeks may be asked to take one additional step before boarding — stepping on the scale. The purpose of the airline’s policy is to obtain data about the aircraft’s fuel needs and weight distribution.

question_sentence: What is the purpose of the $750 million in federal funding awarded to Delaware, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey for the Mid-Atlantic Hydrogen Hub?
choices: To fund research and development of residential hydrogen power.
To reduce carbon emissions in residential heating.
To support hydrogen power projects for heavy industrial uses.
To create hydrogen power plants for residential electricity.

question_sentence: Cryptocurrency guru Sam Bankman-Fried was convicted of fraud and conspiracy in a scandal that rocked the financial industry. What was the name of his company?
evidence: Bankman-Fried founded the crypto exchange FTX.

question_sentence: An activist poured what over Keir Starmer during his Labour Party Conference speech?
evidence: Yaz Ashmawi, an activist linked to a group called People Demand Democracy, has since apologised for grabbing Starmer after storming on stage as the Labour leader addressed delegates in Liverpool on Tuesday. Police said a 28-year-old from Surrey had been arrested on suspicion of assault, breach of the peace and causing public nuisance, and subsequently bailed.

question_sentence: Two planes collided on a runway this week, causing a massive fireball. Where did the incident occur?
evidence: The collision occurred at Tokyo’s Haneda airport on Tuesday. Hundreds of passengers aboard a Japan Airlines flight were safely evacuated in the terrifying ordeal.

question_sentence: Who was named the CAA’s co-defensive player of the week after his standout performance as a cornerback in Delaware's victory against New Hampshire, despite being flagged three times for pass interference during the game?

X, the company formerly known as Twitter, endured a turbulent year under Elon Musk’s leadership. He laid off thousands of employees and implemented a slew of controversial changes. Amid the chaos, rival Meta introduced a new social media app. What is it called?
evidence: Meta launched Threads as X struggled to keep users and advertisers from abandoning the platform.

question_sentence: The Beatles song “Here Comes the Sun” surpassed 1 million streams on Spotify Tuesday. All of these hits have also surpassed that tally except:
choices: “One Dance” by Drake, Wizkid and Kyla

question_sentence: Which US state became the first in which Robert F. Kennedy Jr. qualified for the 2024 presidential ballot?
evidence: Independent candidate and anti-vaccine activist Kennedy successfully filed to put his name on the ballot in Utah after collecting the 1,000 voter signatures required for independents to get access. The scion of America's most famous political family initially planned to run for the Democratic Party nomination but announced in October that he was going it alone.

question_sentence: What holiday-themed Pop-Tart flavor did Pop-Tarts playfully suggest on their Instagram, eliciting mixed reactions?
According to new data released by Nielsen this week, Super Bowl 57 is the most-watched ever. It surpassed which previous matchup?
Climate change is making Earth’s oceans change color, new research finds. Which color are they changing to?
evidence: Tropical oceans have become greener in the past two decades, reflecting changes in their ecosystems that have more phytoplankton present.

question_sentence: A row erupted over Bradley Cooper’s prosthetic nose in an upcoming biopic about which Jewish composer?
evidence: The teaser trailer for “Maestro”, about the legendary creator of “West Side Story”, shows star Cooper wearing a prominent prosthetic nose. The actor, who also directed and co-produced the Netflix biopic, was accused of “Jewface” – when a non-Jewish actor plays a Jewish person and exaggerates so-called “Jewish” characteristics.

question_sentence: Which of the following statements about traveling to Puerto Rico from Wilmington Airport is FALSE?
choices: U.S. citizens do not need a passport to fly to San Juan.
Nonstop flights from Wilmington to San Juan will be offered three times a week.
Visitors will be required to pass through the U.S. Department of Agriculture’s check before returning to the continental U.S.
The west side of Puerto Rico is known for having some of the best beaches on the island.

question_sentence: The deadliest US wildfire in more than 100 years devastated Hawaii in August. Which island popular with tourists suffered catastrophic damage?
evidence: The wildfire left parts of Maui in ruins and killed more than 100 people.

question_sentence: Which company is planning to label “realistic” AI-generated content?
evidence: YouTube will soon require disclosures on videos that contain content generated by artificial intelligence and could mislead viewers.

question_sentence: What incident initially brought Timothy Edward Olschafskie to the attention of Delaware authorities on March 11?
The Writers Guild of America, which represents many Hollywood scribes, went on strike this week. They last hit the picket lines in what year?

Donald Trump was indicted on criminal charges in four separate cases: hush money paid to an adult film star in New York, the classified documents probe in Florida, his attempt to overturn the 2020 election that led to the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol, and his efforts to reverse his electoral defeat in Georgia. How many total charges does Trump face?
evidence: Trump faces 91 criminal charges. He has pleaded not guilty to all of them and accused Democrats of targeting him politically.

question_sentence: A NASA telescope recently spotted a phenomenon in deep space that looked like which symbol?
evidence: NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope captured an image of a cosmic object shaped like a glowing question mark. Scientists believe it could be the interaction of two colliding galaxies.

question_sentence: Which GOP lawmaker called for a formal impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden?
evidence: McCarthy has called for a formal impeachment inquiry into Biden amid pressure from conservatives, even as they have yet to prove allegations he directly profited off his son’s foreign business deals.

question_sentence: The UK's first consumption room for illegal drugs has been given the go-ahead to open in which city?
evidence: Proposals for a "safe" consumption room, where users can take drugs under medical supervision, had been discussed for years – but now Scotland's chief public prosecutor has said that users would not be prosecuted for possession while at the facility, allowing the trial to get under way. Glasgow has long had "the worst drug death rate in Europe", said Al Jazeera.

question_sentence: What type of weather event caused the damage to parts of northwest Delaware this week?
Which new Channel 4 series has provoked almost 1,000 complaints to Ofcom?
choices: Naked, Alone and Racing to Get Home
evidence: The six-part show, hosted by Anna Richardson, features adults removing their clothes in front of teenagers, sparking criticism from viewers and Conservative MPs.

question_sentence: How many potential UFO cases is the US government currently tracking?
evidence: The US government is tracking more than 650 potential UFO cases, according to the Pentagon. Despite continued speculation, officials reiterated this week that there’s no evidence of extraterrestrial life in the sightings.

question_sentence: What significant change has occurred in the sale of Delaware surf-fishing permits for 2024?
choices: The cost of surf-fishing permits has increased.
Reservations are no longer required for driving on the beach on summer weekends and holidays.
There is now a limit on the number of surf-fishing permits that can be sold.
A reservations system for "peak days" has been introduced.

question_sentence: The Miami Heat eliminated the Milwaukee Bucks from the playoffs. Miami is the first No. 8 seed to win an NBA playoff series since:
World leaders gathered at the annual United Nations General Assembly summit this week. Where is the UN headquartered?
evidence: The United Nations is headquartered in New York City. On Tuesday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky made his first in-person address to the UN General Assembly since Russia invaded his country.

question_sentence: Which type of lunar phenomenon lit up the night sky this week?
evidence: A sturgeon supermoon created a magnificent sight across the world this week. This luminous spectacle occurs when the moon nears its closest point to Earth while appearing full.

question_sentence: Novak Djokovic defeated Casper Ruud in the French Open to claim his 23rd Grand Slam title. Who is he now tied with for major singles titles?
Which country is now the sole bidder to host the 2034 Fifa World Cup?
evidence: The Middle East country became the de facto front-runner to host the 2034 tournament after Australia pulled out hours before Fifa's "declarations of interest" deadline on Tuesday. The kingdom's "unprecedented investment" in sports in recent years "always seemingly intended to lead to this moment", said the BBC's sports editor Dan Roan.

question_sentence: Fox News rocked the media world this week when it announced it would part ways with which top-rated host?
evidence: Fox News and Tucker Carlson, the right-wing extremist who hosted the network’s prime time 8 p.m. hour, have severed ties, the network said in a stunning announcement on Monday.

question_sentence: Which group of unionized employees walked off their jobs recently in an unprecedented strike?
evidence: Thousands of autoworkers are on strike against General Motors, Ford and Stellantis — which makes cars under the Chrysler, Dodge, Jeep and Ram brands. It is the first time in history that the United Auto Workers union has struck all of America’s Big Three automakers at the same time.

question_sentence: Vladimir Putin avoided possible arrest by deciding to skip a summit in which city?
evidence: The Russian leader will not attend an economic summit in Johannesburg next month, ducking the possibility of arrest on an International Criminal Court (ICC) indictment accusing him of war crimes. As a member of the ICC, South Africa would have been obliged to arrest Putin if he visited the country, but Russia had “made it clear” that this would be “a declaration of war”, said South Africa’s president, Cyril Ramaphosa.

question_sentence: New polling data suggests that what percentage of 18- to 24-year-olds in the UK want to replace the monarchy with an elected head of state?
evidence: In a YouGov survey of 4,592 British voters, almost one in four Gen Z respondents said the British monarchy should be replaced with an elected head of state. Almost 60% said they believed King Charles was out of touch with the public.

question_sentence: A mysterious upcoming book that became a bestseller amid rumours that it was Taylor Swift’s memoir was actually written by which other music stars?
evidence: The guessing game began last week when the book appeared on multiple bookseller websites under the name 4C Untitled Flatiron Nonfiction Summer 2023. But publishing house Flatiron Books has solved the mystery by revealing that the eagerly anticipated release is about the K-pop boyband and will be published in July under the title Beyond the Story: 10-Year Record of BTS.

question_sentence: What is the location of the first Bubbakoo’s Burritos restaurant?
Connecticut won the NCAA men’s basketball national title Monday after defeating San Diego State. How many championships does the program have?
Why did former Delaware Auditor Kathy McGuiness appeal to the Delaware Supreme Court?
choices: To challenge her misdemeanor public corruption conviction.
To defend her daughter's employment in the auditor’s office.
To appeal her loss in the fall primary for re-election.
To sue Attorney General Kathy Jennings.

question_sentence: Which state passed a bill this week banning most sales of assault-style weapons?
evidence: In the wake of several recent mass shootings, Washington’s Democratic Gov. Jay Inslee this week signed a statewide ban on most sales of assault-style weapons, including the popular AR-15 rifle.

question_sentence: Which iconic 1990s children’s toy is set to be relaunched?
evidence: Maker Hasbro is relaunching the robotic fluffy toy for the 25th anniversary of its original release, but with one important design change – the new model has an off switch. The original Furbys could not be shut down and were prone to “wake up” and start chatting in the night.

question_sentence: Which US congressman this week announced his decision to retire from Congress at the end of this year "to serve America in new ways"?
evidence: The California Republican announced his resignation in a newspaper column on Wednesday, two months after becoming the first House speaker in history to be ousted from the role. The imminent departure of McCarthy from Congress, after 17 years in office, will leave his party with a slim 220-213 majority in the chamber.

question_sentence: Who ended Max Verstappen’s 10-race winning streak by claiming victory at the Singapore Grand Prix?
evidence: The Spanish racing ace claimed victory for Ferrari by narrowly beating his close friend and former McLaren teammate Norris to the finish line in the streets of Singapore on Sunday. Verstappen trailed in fifth position, behind Leclerc and Hamilton.

question_sentence: Who wrote “The Star-Spangled Banner?”
evidence: On September 14, 1814, Francis Scott Key penned a poem after witnessing the Battle of Fort McHenry in Baltimore during the War of 1812 (which actually lasted until 1815). His poem was later set to music, and in 1931, it became America’s national anthem.

question_sentence: Which European royal announced their surprise abdication in a New Year's Eve speech?
evidence: The world's only reigning queen and Europe's longest-serving monarch said she would step down on 14 January – 52 years to the day since she became monarch following the death of her father, King Frederik IX. The throne will go to her 55-year-old son, Crown Prince Frederik.

question_sentence: State labs recently found “extremely high” levels of lead in which popular snack food?
evidence: Multiple lots of cinnamon-flavored applesauce products were recalled following several cases of high blood lead levels in children. There have been nearly two dozen cases across 14 states, the CDC said.

question_sentence: Which state's board of education voted to ban teaching about sexual orientation and gender identity from kindergarten through 12th grade?
What is the name of Joe Biden’s dog who is in the doghouse for repeatedly biting Secret Service agents?
evidence: According to a report from a conservative watchdog group, the US president’s dog has bitten Secret Service agents at least 10 times. The 22-month-old German Shepherd, a gift from Biden’s brother James, has been given “additional leashing protocols” following the incidents.

question_sentence: Which US President signed a bill making Juneteenth a federal holiday?
evidence: On June 17, 2021, President Joe Biden signed a bill into law recognizing Juneteenth National Independence Day. Biden said the moment will go down as “one of the greatest honors” of his presidency.

question_sentence: HBO's "Succession," which aired its series finale this week, centers on the (fictional) Roy family, the owners of what company?
Prince Harry and Duchess Meghan's team said they were in a harrowing "car chase" fueled by paparazzi in what city?
Insulin manufacturers are making their products available to more Americans at what price?
evidence: More Americans with diabetes can get insulin for $35 now that a third major drugmaker is offering price caps and savings programs that lower the cost of the medication.

question_sentence: Which day this week was dedicated to volunteering, donating, and doing good for others?
evidence: A few days after Black Friday, millions of people celebrated Giving Tuesday (the Tuesday after Thanksgiving) by volunteering, doing good and donating to causes around the world.

question_sentence: Which foreign leader told their party "I, too, am human" after taking a day off?
evidence: Italy's prime minister marked her first anniversary in power by taking a "personal day", after splitting from her scandal-hit partner, television presenter Andrea Giambruno. Speaking via video link to a conference held by her Brothers in Italy party on Sunday – two days after she announced the break-up – Meloni said she was "sorry to not be with you in person”.

question_sentence: Which team was dramatically knocked out of the Women’s World Cup during a penalty shootout against Sweden?
evidence: The US Women’s National Team was shockingly eliminated from the Women’s World Cup in the round-of-16 after losing a penalty shootout against Sweden. It was the earliest exit ever for the two-time reigning champions at the tournament.

question_sentence: More than 70,000 festival attendees were stranded in the Nevada desert when torrential rain overwhelmed their campsites with ankle-deep mud. What was the name of the festival?
evidence: Tens of thousands of Burning Man attendees had to wait a few days for things to dry out before the roads reopened and they were able to leave.

question_sentence: What is the opening time for the new Helen's Sausage House location in Newark?
choices: 4 a.m. to noon Monday through Saturday
10 p.m. to 2 a.m. on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday

question_sentence: How much was spent on legal services by Delaware schools in the last fiscal year, from October 1 to September 30?
Which public figure this week announced she will launch a healthy food and beverage company for kids?
choices: Former New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern
