evidence: Former First Lady Michelle Obama announced Wednesday that she’s launching a healthy food and beverage company for kids to help combat the “nutrition-related health crisis” in the US.

question_sentence: While historical accounts of what was eaten at the first Thanksgiving vary, which food was definitely not on the menu?
evidence: Potatoes, which are native to South America, had not made their way to New England in the 1600s.

question_sentence: Scientists in the Alps and the Arctic have discovered microbes that can eat what at cool temperatures?
evidence: Many microorganisms can digest plastic at temperatures above 30C, but the discovery by researchers at the Swiss Federal Institute paves the way for a much more energy-efficient method of recycling.

question_sentence: The CDC this week announced it will no longer distribute which item?
evidence: The CDC is no longer distributing Covid-19 vaccination cards, the white cards that were given out with vaccines earlier in the pandemic.

question_sentence: Data shows that which infectious disease is overtaking Covid-19 as the world’s most deadly?
evidence: Experts fear that TB represents a “ticking timebomb”, amid soaring infection and death rates. Latest figures suggest that the disease killed around 4,400 people a day worldwide in 2021.

question_sentence: The convicted murderer who escaped from a Pennsylvania prison was captured Wednesday. How many days was he able to evade law enforcement?
evidence: Danilo Cavalcante was able to hide for 13 days until police found him in the woods of South Coventry Township, lying on top of a rifle he had stolen from a nearby resident days earlier. A police dog named Yoda was released on him, biting him and preventing him from using the rifle before police took him into custody.

question_sentence: Which luxury watch company is opening a store at the Christiana Mall on November 15?
In what is believed to be Scotland’s most lethal mass stranding, a pod of which species washed ashore on the Isle of Lewis?
evidence: Almost a whole pod of pilot whales died after 55 washed up on a remote beach on the Outer Hebridean island. Pilot whales are “notorious for their strong social bonds”, said British Divers Marine Life Rescue. The charity believes the pod might have followed one of the whales ashore after it had difficulty giving birth.

question_sentence: Which pop duo are embroiled in a legal battle after one obtained a restraining order against the other?
evidence: Daryl Hall is suing his musical partner John Oates and has obtained a restraining order against him as part of the sealed lawsuit. The case between the US duo, who are the most commercially successful duo in the history of pop music, reportedly involves "contract/debt".

question_sentence: Which public figure will plead guilty to federal tax charges?
evidence: Hunter Biden, the son of President Joe Biden, will plead guilty to two tax misdemeanors and struck a deal with federal prosecutors to resolve a felony gun charge, the Justice Department said Tuesday in court filings. As part of the plea agreement, the DOJ has agreed to recommend a sentence of probation for the two counts of failing to pay taxes in a timely matter for the years 2017 and 2018, according to sources.

question_sentence: What two Union border states continued to practice slavery up until the 13th Amendment was ratified?
evidence: Slavery remained technically legal in Union states until 1865, and some areas of Delaware and Kentucky continued the practice until that time.

question_sentence: Facebook parent company Meta launched a new app this week as a direct rival of Twitter. What is the app called?
evidence: Meta launched an app called Threads that is intended to offer a space for real-time conversations online — a function that has long been Twitter’s core selling point.

question_sentence: In her final speech as New Zealand’s prime minister, who did Jacinda Ardern assure that “they too could one day lead”?
evidence: As she bowed out of New Zealand’s parliament, Ardern gave a rousing speech calling for politics to be opened up to atypical leaders. She said: “You can be anxious, sensitive, kind and wear your heart on your sleeve. You can be a mother, or not, an ex-Mormon, or not, a nerd, a crier, a hugger – you can be all of these things, and not only can you be here – you can lead.” Ardern announced her shock resignation in January, saying she had “no more left in the tank”.

question_sentence: Which country declared a state of emergency this week over the threat of a possible volcanic eruption?
evidence: Around 1,000 earthquakes recently hit Iceland within a 24-hour span. The world-famous Blue Lagoon thermal pool in the area was forced to temporarily close due to the ongoing seismic activity.

question_sentence: Actor Michael Lerner, whose career spanned 60 years, died this week. Which of these movies did he have a role in?
Turkey is typically the centerpiece of Thanksgiving dinner. Which US state raises the most turkeys?
evidence: Minnesota gobbled up the competition with 37 million turkeys raised in 2022.

question_sentence: What inspired Joshua Sheppard to raise donations for Sean's Room at Saint Mark's High School?
choices: The story of Sean Locke and the SL24 Foundation

question_sentence: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers suffered a season-ending injury this week, devastating many football fans. Which NFL team is he currently a part of?
evidence: While making his debut with the New York Jets, Rodgers was carted off the field after suffering a left Achilles injury on just his fourth play in the team’s Monday Night Football game against the Buffalo Bills.

question_sentence: Cranberry sauce is a holiday staple. How many pounds of cranberries do Americans consume during Thanksgiving week?
evidence: Americans consume 80 million pounds of cranberries during Thanksgiving week and nearly 400 million pounds total per year – mostly in the form of juice or juice blends.

question_sentence: Where is the global COP28 climate summit being held?
evidence: Tens of thousands of people are heading to Dubai for COP28, the annual international climate summit convened by the United Nations.

question_sentence: Which US author is pulling a novel set in Russia from publication?
evidence: The best-selling author of “Eat, Pray, Love” asked her publishers to postpone the publication of her novel “The Snow Forest”, which is set in 20th century Siberia, following a backlash from Ukrainian readers. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: What was the final selling price of the N.C. Wyeth painting "Ramona" that was purchased for $4 from a thrift store?
Tim Scott announced his campaign for president this week. Scott is a Republican senator for which state?
A man in the US has attempted to break a world record by balancing what on his finger?
evidence: David Rush, who already boasts more than 250 Guinness World Records, balanced an umbrella on his finger for three hours and 46 minutes. His time beat the current record, said UPI, but must still be reviewed. For more stories from the stranger side of life, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which world leader announced he and his spouse have agreed to separate after 18 years of marriage?
evidence: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced Wednesday that he and his wife Sophie Grégoire Trudeau are separating. The Trudeaus have three children together, all under the age of 15.

question_sentence: Pumpkins were readily available in America during the first Thanksgiving, but the Pilgrims lacked all the ingredients – namely butter and wheat flour – needed to make pumpkin pie. What other dessert might they have made with pumpkins?
evidence: English settlers in North America were known to make a custard with milk, honey and spices and roast it in a hollowed-out pumpkin.

question_sentence: Bill Irvin, owner of The Brandywine Restaurant, was inspired by classic elegance and a dining experience from the '50s and '60s. What is the special place he aimed to create with this restaurant?
choices: A fine dining experience reminiscent of the past

question_sentence: Which racquet sport has been blamed for driving a surge in health insurance claims in the US?
evidence: According to investment bank UBS, an analysis of US health insurance claims found that up to $500 million of medical costs were “directly attributable” to the sport, a cross between tennis, badminton and table tennis that is especially popular with pensioners, For more odd and unexpected news, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Tribute events were held for former first lady Rosalynn Carter this week in which state?
evidence: Three days of planned tributes took place across Georgia for Rosalynn Carter, the state where she grew up alongside her husband, former President Jimmy Carter. She died on November 19 at the age of 96.

question_sentence: A swimwear trend known as what is taking hold on China’s beaches?
evidence: The face coverings are made of UV-resistant material and are designed to protect the wearer’s head, face and neck from sun exposure. For more odd and unexpected news, sign up to the Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: The CDC declared measles was eliminated from the US in 2000. However, a new case was reported this week in which state?
evidence: A child in Maine has tested positive for measles, state health officials said. While the virus was declared eliminated more than two decades ago, health officials say vaccination rates in the US have dropped in recent years, sparking new outbreaks.

question_sentence: What percentage of British adults think that King Charles is doing a “good job” as monarch?
evidence: That’s up from 49% last month according to polling by Ipsos for The Telegraph. In the same polling, it was found that 50% believe that too much money was spent on the coronation. In April, 33% objected to the cost. Almost two-thirds were aware of the arrests of anti-monarchy protesters at the coronation, and of those, only two in five thought the police had acted appropriately.

question_sentence: According to a recent study, which nutrient-rich food was once a staple for early Europeans?
evidence: Seaweed and aquatic plants were once a staple food for ancient Europeans, according to a new analysis of dental fossils.

question_sentence: Cell phones blared to life at 4:45 a.m. ET in Florida with an emergency alert detailing:
choices: A test of the alert system
A group of alligators on the loose

question_sentence: The UK’s so-called “wonkiest pub” has closed after almost 200 years of trading in which county?
evidence: The historic Crooked House, in the village of Himley, has called time following 192 years of trading, after being sold to a private buyer “for alternative use”.

question_sentence: British scientists are launching an attempt to "refreeze" sea ice in which region?
evidence: A team from the University of Cambridge is joining an international team in the Canadian High Arctic this week to test whether pumping seawater on top of the ice to make it thicker and longer-lasting. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which city this week elected its first female mayor?
evidence: CNN projects Democrat Donna Deegan will become Jacksonville’s first female mayor. This marks only the second time in 30 years that a Democrat will win the office in Florida’s most populous city.

question_sentence: Why did German artist Boris Eldagsen refuse to accept a Sony World Photography Award for his image Pseudomnesia: The Electrician?
choices: He thought rival entries were better
It was generated by artificial intelligence
The judges included his former partner
evidence: Eldagsen explained on his website that he submitted the black-and-white image “as a cheeky monkey, to find out if the competitions are prepared for AI images to enter”. He concluded: “They are not.”

question_sentence: Which state this week experienced heavy rainfall described by officials as a 1-in-1,000-year event?
evidence: Between 14 and 20 inches were dumped on South Florida over a 24-hour period. The downpour closed schools and Fort Lauderdale’s airport.

question_sentence: Talks between the UK, Spain and the EU over the status of Gibraltar have stalled over what?
evidence: Downing Street has dismissed Spain’s demand to oversee control of Gibraltar’s airport, which is technically on an RAF base despite lying on a narrow stretch of land between Gibraltar and the Spanish frontier. The EU is considering allowing the British overseas territory – which voted to remain in the bloc – to join the Schengen common travel area.

question_sentence: 2. Elon Musk's X is suing which organisation for defamation over reports of ads on the platform appearing next to antisemitic posts?
evidence: In a lawsuit filed on Monday, Musk accused the media watchdog of defaming X, formerly known as Twitter, after companies including Apple, IBM and Disney pulled adverts from the platform following reports of antisemitic content. Media Matters, which stood by its reporting, is accused of manipulating algorithms "to bypass safeguards and create images of X's largest advertisers' paid posts adjacent to racist, incendiary content".

question_sentence: Disney's copyright of Mickey and Minnie Mouse and which of Winnie the Pooh's sidekicks expired this week?
evidence: The bouncy tiger jumped into the public domain along with Mickey and Minnie on 1 January, when 95 years of copyright protection of the characters expired. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: What aspect of Jamin Pugh's legacy was recently honored in Laurel, Delaware?
choices: His achievements as a professional wrestler
His accomplishments in the music industry

question_sentence: Short daily naps may help keep the brain healthy by doing what, according to a newly published University College London study?
choices: Improving blood flow to the hippocampus
evidence: The analysis of data on people aged 40 to 69 linked habitual naps with larger brain volume equivalent to up to 6.5 fewer years of ageing. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which news organization this week agreed to the largest publicly known defamation settlement in US history?
evidence: Fox News will pay more than $787 million to Dominion Voting Systems after the two sides agreed to a last-minute settlement Tuesday in the explosive defamation case brought against the right-wing network.

question_sentence: Which political figure visited Maui this week to witness up close the devastation left by the wildfires?
evidence: President Biden visited fire-ravaged Maui as search efforts continue. He sought to reassure residents that the federal government will support their long-term recovery efforts while respecting local traditions.

question_sentence: Why did Buybuy Baby close in 2023?
choices: Bankruptcy of the parent company Bed Bath and Beyond
Decline in customer interest in baby products
High operating costs and low sales

question_sentence: Authorities are searching for several men after they recently escaped from jail in which state?
evidence: Four men escaped from a Mississippi jail over the weekend, officials said. One of them was found dead in a burned building after a standoff with authorities, and a second was apprehended in Texas. As of Friday, authorities were continuing their search for the two surviving escaped inmates.

question_sentence: The world’s last gaslit cinema is reopening in which city?
evidence: The Yorkshire city’s Hyde Park Picture House reopened on Friday 30 June after a £4.8 million restoration. The cinema first opened its doors in 1914, with gas lights installed to deter “inappropriate behaviour” by patrons.

question_sentence: On what grounds has Egypt’s Ministry of Tourism of Antiquities criticised new Netflix docuseries Queen Cleopatra?
choices: The series was filmed in Spain
evidence: Egypt’s Ministry of Tourism and Antiquities released a statement emphasising that “Queen Cleopatra had light skin and Hellenistic (Greek) features”, and criticising Netflix for casting British actor Adele James, who “possesses African features and dark skin”. Find out more on the latest episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Astronomers announced they found a planet around 120 light-years away from Earth that might have all the elements needed to sustain life. What is the planet’s name?
evidence: NASA said exoplanet K2-18b may have some key features of a planet that could support bodies of water — and life.

question_sentence: Which country’s outdated rail network was criticized this week in the wake of a devastating train accident?
evidence: A deadly train crash in India has renewed calls for authorities to confront safety issues in a railway system that transports more than 13 million passengers every day.

question_sentence: Which streaming giant warned its U.S. subscribers this week that it's cracking down on password-sharing with people outside their household?
According to a new survey, approximately how many nurses left the workforce due to pandemic-related burnout and stress?
evidence: About 100,000 registered nurses in the US left the workplace due to the stresses of the Covid-19 pandemic, according to the results of a survey published Thursday by the National Council of State Boards of Nursing.

question_sentence: Which US state announced a ban on TikTok this week?
evidence: Montana Gov. Greg Gianforte signed a bill Wednesday banning TikTok in the state over perceived security concerns. The controversial law, which will take effect in January, outlines potential fines of $10,000 per day for violators.

question_sentence: Who did Governor John Carney endorse for the next Delaware governor in 2024?
Which country suspended all football league fixtures after a club president punched a referee at the end of a match?
evidence: Referee Halil Umut Meler was punched to the ground by MKE Ankaragucu president Faruk Koca, and then kicked after fans invaded the pitch, following a 1-1 Super Lig draw with Rizespor in Ankara on Monday. Koca was arrested and the Turkish football federation halted all matches, before later ruling that the league could resume on 19 December.

question_sentence: The nominees for the 75th Emmy Awards — television’s top honor — were announced this week. Which show received the most nominations?
evidence: HBO’s “Succession” led with 27 Emmy nominations, followed by “The Last of Us” with 24. The Emmy Awards are currently scheduled for September 18. (HBO, which like CNN, is owned by Warner Bros. Discovery.)

question_sentence: What is the title of Joe Biden's first re-election campaign ad of 2024?
evidence: Published on the US president's YouTube channel, the minute-long campaign video features images from the January 6 Capitol riot and is narrated by Biden, who warns that Republican primary front-runner Donald Trump has tried to "erode American democracy and excuse – and even promote – political violence". The attack ad has run on national TV and in local markets in swing states such as Arizona, Georgia, Michigan, Nevada, North Carolina, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin, as well as online.

question_sentence: The Federal Trade Commission announced this week it is suing which company, alleging it tricked millions of consumers into signing up for its paid subscription service?
evidence: The FTC is suing Amazon, alleging that the e-commerce giant has tricked millions of consumers into signing up for its Prime subscription service through deceptive user interface designs. The complaint also takes aim at Amazon for allegedly trying to keep users subscribed who wished to cancel their memberships.

question_sentence: How much did Hayao Miyazaki's new film "The Boy and the Heron" earn in the US and Canada in its opening weekend?
evidence: The long-awaited animated fantasy from Miyazaki's Studio Ghibli is the first original anime title in history to top the North American box office chart. The film is getting rave reviews but is rumoured to be the last from 82-year-old Miyazaki.

question_sentence: More than 30,000 pounds of which food product were recently recalled?
evidence: Tyson Foods recalled over 30,000 pounds of chicken nuggets after some consumers reported finding small metal pieces in their dinosaur-shaped patties.

question_sentence: Where did the fourth Republican presidential debate take place this week?
evidence: Republican candidates faced off Wednesday night in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, in the fourth presidential debate of the 2024 election cycle.

question_sentence: Warner Bros. this week announced that the long-awaited sequel to this beloved movie starring Michael Keaton will hit theaters in 2024:
What has been the impact of the COVID pandemic on the market values of vacant residential properties in Wilmington?
choices: The market values have increased significantly.
The market values have decreased significantly.
The market values have remained the same.
The market values have fluctuated unpredictably.

question_sentence: Which state is revising its planned 2024 license plate design following hundreds of complaints?
evidence: One major criticism of the proposed 2024 Kansas license plate design is the color scheme, with many saying it resembled those of other states and the University of Missouri — a rival of the University of Kansas.

question_sentence: Approximately how many smartphone notifications do teenagers receive each day?
evidence: A new report suggests teens get as many as 237 or more notifications each day on their smartphones. Researchers also found teenagers often leave their notifications on even when they feel bombarded.

question_sentence: Who has been named the UK's most influential black person by the Powerlist 2024?
evidence: The Ghanaian-born former stylist became the first black editor-in-chief of British Vogue in 2017, but announced earlier this year that he was stepping down. Doctor Who star Ncuti Gatwa, actor Sir Lenny Henry, football pundit Alex Scott and "The Diary of a CEO" podcaster Steven Bartlett are also on Powerful Media's 2024 list celebrating people of African, African Caribbean and African American heritage.

question_sentence: At least 12 people were injured when a crane collapsed this week in which major city?
evidence: A crane collapsed Wednesday in New York City while the operator was lifting about 16 tons of concrete, officials said. Dramatic video showed flames and smoke rising from the crane before its boom fell, hitting a building across the street.

question_sentence: Which school won the College Football Playoff National Championship this week?
evidence: The Michigan Wolverines were victorious in Monday’s championship game against the Washington Huskies. It is Michigan’s first college football national title since 1997.

question_sentence: Brazil's president Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva warned fellow world leaders of the risk of another coup in which country?
evidence: Nearly 70 years after the Central American country's first democratically elected government was toppled, there are warnings that the son of its first democratically elected president – surprise presidential election winner Bernardo Arévalo – may be facing the same fate, with electoral officials suspending his centre-left Semilla party. For more stories from around the world, sign up to our weekly Global Digest newsletter.

question_sentence: Customs agents at a Minnesota airport seized a box of giraffe poo from a woman who wanted to use the droppings to make what?
evidence: The unnamed Iowa woman, who was returning from Kenya, declared the small box of poo and explained her plan after her belongings were inspected at Minneapolis-Saint Paul airport. She told officials that she had previously made a necklace with moose faeces, but the border protection agency destroyed the giraffe droppings, citing their potential to spread disease.

question_sentence: Newly released figures show that which UK airport was the worst for delays last year?
evidence: The airport was the worst for a second year in a row, with flights in 2022 leaving half an hour behind schedule on average. East Midlands Airport was the top performer, with average delays of just 13 minutes, while the UK average was 23 minutes, according to data from the Civil Aviation Authority.

question_sentence: Which Delaware diner was known for its quirky design, featuring a mock crashed plane on its roof as a roadside attraction?
Experts estimate that how many of around two million Britons with long Covid are in need of specialist care?
evidence: According to The Mirror, experts at the UK’s first long Covid clinic, at University College Hospital London, estimate that hundreds of thousands of patients are in need of specialist care for ailments ranging from severe fatigue to brain fog. But “so far only 100,000 have been offered treatment”, the paper reported.

question_sentence: Polling suggests that what percentage of Americans think Joe Biden does not have the “mental sharpness” to serve a second term as president?
evidence: The Washington Post/ABC poll of more than 1,000 people found that 43% believed that 80-year-old Biden and Donald Trump, 76, are both too old to serve another term. If Biden is re-elected in 2024, he would be 82 when he takes office and 86 when his second term ends.

question_sentence: Which American football team claimed victory against the Kansas City Chiefs in a Super Bowl rematch this week?
evidence: After being defeated by the Chiefs at the Super Bowl LVII in February, the Eagles got their revenge on Monday with a 21-17 win.The game marked the ninth time in NFL history that two teams from the previous Super Bowl have faced off the following season.

question_sentence: Why was the latest Panera Charged Lemonade lawsuit filed in Delaware?
choices: Because the plaintiff, Dennis Brown, had a chromosomal deficiency disorder.
Because the Delaware Superior Court has a reputation for handling high-profile cases.
Because Panera is a Delaware corporation with its registered agent in Wilmington.
Because the family of Sarah Katz, the first lawsuit plaintiff, requested it.

question_sentence: The shock winner of Argentina’s presidential primary elections, far-right candidate Javier Milei famously claims to be what?
evidence: Javier Milei sent the value of the peso plummeting when he pulled off a landslide win in the primary elections. The far-right economics professor “shot to daytime TV fame” in the 2010s, said The Guardian, as a self-described “tantric sex coach who spoke openly about his preference for threesomes”.

question_sentence: What sensitive item was lost, then found, on a Belfast street during President Joe Biden's visit to Northern Ireland?
choices: A document with Biden's security plan
A flash drive containing White House passwords

question_sentence: The appearance of Donald Trump at a broadcast “town hall” meeting held by which news channel has caused ongoing controversy this week?
evidence: CNN recently organised a live prime-time town hall question-and-answer session featuring former president Donald Trump. In a setting fuelled by a supportive audience, Trump swiftly assumed control of the event. He frequently interrupted the moderator, labelling her as “nasty”, while reiterating claims of a “rigged” 2020 election. Despite facing significant backlash for the broadcast, CNN CEO Chris Licht expressed his unwavering support for the town hall concept. He said he believed history will view the network’s decision to interview Trump, surrounded by cheering supporters, favourably. But he added that he would like to improve some production elements.

question_sentence: Chris Licht, the embattled CEO of which company stepped down this week?
Who is considering running for governor in Delaware in 2024?
choices: New Castle County Executive Matt Meyer

question_sentence: The UK’s bees are in danger from which invasive species, according to a new report?
evidence: Asian hornets are “wreaking havoc” in mainland Europe, according to a new report by leading scientists. There has been a sharp spike in sightings, with nests found in Sussex, Kent, Devon and Dorset, said the BBC, raising fears of “catastrophic consequences” for the UK’s bee populations.

question_sentence: Which pop star sent the internet into a frenzy after making a surprise appearance at a Kansas City Chiefs football game?
evidence: Following weeks of dating speculation, Taylor Swift was seen celebrating in Travis Kelce’s family suite at the Kansas City Chiefs game on Sunday. Her surprise appearance was trending on social media and brought a 400% surge in Kelce’s jersey sales.

question_sentence: Which late celebrity is being "brought back to life" using AI in order to narrate a biopic?
evidence: Warner Music Group has announced that artificial intelligence will be used to recreate the "voice and image" of the "La Vie en Rose" singer, who died in 1963, for the upcoming 90-minute biopic. Titled "Edith", the film is billed to tell the story of how she became “a symbol of female empowerment and one of France's most iconic artists of all time”.

question_sentence: When does daylight saving time officially end in 2023?
Ukraine’s battlefield forces are communicating via Elon Musk’s Starlink network, which has how many satellites in orbit?
evidence: Pentagon officials have voiced unease over their reliance on Musk and his companies after the US Department of Defense signed a contract for SpaceX to provide Starlink satellite services for Ukraine. Starlink’s network now accounts for more than half of all active satellites.

question_sentence: True or false: This week marked the first time a Petit Basset Griffon Vendéen won best in show at the Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show.
What is the primary issue discussed in the article " 'Beats living on the streets:' The Delawareans who call motels home during the holidays"?
choices: The challenges faced by individuals living in motels during the holidays, including lack of housing options.
The efforts of outreach groups to provide food, clothing, and toys to motel residents during the holidays.
The specific circumstances of Cheryl Dayton, a motel resident, and her transition to affordable housing.
The impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on America's housing crisis.

question_sentence: The NFL announced its inaugural game on Black Friday will feature the revamped New York Jets hosting which team?
Wembley Stadium celebrated what landmark event this week?
choices: Becoming the UK’s first carbon-neutral stadium
evidence: The first football match at what was then called the Empire Stadium took place on 28 April 1923. During its century-long history, Wembley has been the site of England’s 1966 World Cup victory, the 1985 Live Aid concert and the Lionesses’ victory in the Women’s Euros last year.
