choices: A discount on their next purchase
A chance to win a billion-dollar prize

question_sentence: Latest polling suggests that Labour and the Tories are "neck and neck" in the upcoming by-election in which constituency?
evidence: The Survation poll, commissioned by the Labour Together group, found that the Labour and Conservative candidates for the previously safe Tory seat were level-pegging on 29% each. But pundits said that with the Lib Dems candidate on 22%, a split “progressive” vote could spell victory for the Tories in the October by-election, which was triggered by the resignation of Nadine Dorries.

question_sentence: What is the primary time frame for the "bed bug season"?
NASA will launch a spacecraft to an unexplored metal world this fall. What is the mission called?
evidence: The uncrewed endeavor, known as the Psyche mission, will send the first NASA spacecraft designed to study a metallic asteroid. It is set to launch in October, NASA said.

question_sentence: Which product in the US recently climbed to its highest price of the year?
evidence: Gas prices increased to their highest level of the year on Monday to $3.88 a gallon, according to AAA. Eleven states are averaging $4 or higher a gallon, and in California, the price is now $5.80 a gallon.

question_sentence: Which movie won a number of the major categories at the 2024 Golden Globe Awards?
evidence: Christopher Nolan’s “Oppenheimer” picked up several big awards at the Golden Globes, including best motion picture drama, best director and two acting categories.

question_sentence: Which movie currently holds the top spot on worldwide box office charts?
evidence: The “Barbie” movie, from director Greta Gerwig, scored the largest opening weekend of 2023, pulling in $155 million domestically over its opening weekend and $337 million globally.

question_sentence: Which ranking did Delaware State University achieve in the 2023 U.S. News and World Report rankings for HBCUs?
What is the reason behind McDonald's decision to remove self-serve soda machines from U.S. locations by 2032?
choices: To reduce soda consumption among customers.
To make the experience more consistent for customers and employees.
To cut costs and increase profits.
To combat the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on their business.

question_sentence: Summer is peak season for amusement parks. Where was America’s first roller coaster built?
evidence: The first roller coaster in America opened on Coney Island, in Brooklyn, New York, in 1884.

question_sentence: Thousands of people were recently stranded at which festival?
evidence: Around 70,000 Burning Man attendees were stranded in the Nevada desert following intense rain and muddy conditions.

question_sentence: Which airline recently posted record revenue despite its winter holiday meltdown?
evidence: Months after a holiday service meltdown, Southwest Airlines said its bookings in March were finally back on track. Revenue soared 22% to $5.7 billion in the quarter, according to the company.

question_sentence: Which country issued an arrest warrant for Sen. Lindsey Graham over strong comments he made in a recent video?
What was the name of the suspect arrested in connection with the Dover ambush shootings that killed one and injured three?
An activist is to be prosecuted for contempt of court for holding up a sign outside the trial of protesters from which climate group?
evidence: Civil liberties campaigners said the decision to prosecute retired social worker Trudi Warner for holding up a sign allegedly directed at jurors was part of the government's crackdown on the right to protest. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: All 41 workers trapped in a collapsed tunnel in the northern Himalayas were rescued after how many days stuck underground?
evidence: The workers became trapped when part of the under-construction Silkyara tunnel, in the Indian state of Uttarkashi, collapsed on 12 November following a landslide. They were finally freed on Tuesday, following a large-scale rescue operation.

question_sentence: The House of Representatives has been in disarray following the ousting of speaker Kevin McCarthy. Who did House Republicans pick as their nominee for speaker this week?
evidence: GOP lawmakers selected Steve Scalise as their nominee for the job by a narrow margin as feuds within the House Republican Party threatened to plunge the chamber even deeper into chaos. However, Scalise withdrew his bid for speaker late Thursday after House Republicans failed to coalesce behind him.

question_sentence: A large piece of what was discovered on a beach in Australia?
evidence: The unidentified debris is about the size of a small car and was found washed up on a remote beach some 150 miles north of Perth. Debris has been accruing in space around our planet since the first rocket launches in the late 1950s, with an estimated 36,500 objects greater than 10cm in near-Earth orbit, according to the European Space Agency (ESA).

question_sentence: Fourth of July celebrations took place across the US this week with fireworks displays from coast-to-coast. Which city opted for an innovative drone light show instead?
evidence: Due to fire threats and environmental concerns, Salt Lake City, Utah, tried an alternative way of celebrating Independence Day with its first-ever drone show. Watch some of the other dazzling celebrations that took place across America here.

question_sentence: Which Indian Hindu festival concluded this week?
evidence: The festival celebrates the victory of the goddess Durga over the demon king Mahishasura, and festivities can last up to 10 days. The celebrations in Kolkata, which this year concluded on Tuesday, have earned the city a spot on Unesco's cultural heritage list, “thanks to their grandeur and historical significance", said Indian broadcaster CNBC TV 18.

question_sentence: What team will the University of Delaware’s football team play in 2025 following a move to the Football Bowl Subdivision?
What organization owned and occupied the Elwyn building before it was purchased by the Delaware Affordable Housing Group?
Which celebrity will host the 2024 Academy Awards?
evidence: Comedian Jimmy Kimmel will be returning to host the Oscars for the fourth time.

question_sentence: What was hung from London's Millennium Bridge this week to act as a warning to river traffic that repair work is going on?
evidence: A bale of straw has been hanging from the Millennium Bridge as repair work goes on, in accordance with the Port of London Thames Byelaws. The legislation calls for the suspension of straw by day and a white light at night to warn boats of reduced headroom.

question_sentence: What prompted an investigation into Wilmington police's reporting of fatal crashes, leading to a change in their reporting practices?
choices: A family reaching out to Delaware Online/The News Journal
A request from the Delaware Department of Correction

question_sentence: New research suggests that ancient megalodon sharks were what?
evidence: The giant sharks were much warmer blooded than other similar species, according to new analysis of teeth fossils. The findings may provide clues about what caused the megalodon to go extinct more than three millions years ago.

question_sentence: Users who clicked search results between Oct. 2006 and Sept. 2013 may be entitled to a cut of a $23 million settlement from which search engine?
Because of wildfire risks and an increase in construction costs, State Farm stopped providing home insurance to new customers in which state?
Which of the following statements is false about the car crash near Biden Wilmington headquarters?
choices: The accident happened while Joe Biden was campaigning for the 2024 presidential election.
Joe Biden was injured in the accident.
The car that hit the SUV was driven by a 46-year-old Wilmington man under the influence of alcohol and inattentive driving.
The accident happened on a rainy day

question_sentence: In which Netflix anime series does Aubrey Plaza voice the character Julie Powers?
What is the minimum annual income required for a family of four to be considered middle class in Delaware in 2023, according to the study?
What was the final score in the penalty shoot-out for the FA Community Shield last weekend?
evidence: Arsenal beat Manchester City 4-1 on penalties in the Community Shield at Wembley last weekend after the match finished 1-1 after extra-time. Man City’s Kevin De Bruyne and Rodri both missed their penalties, which led to Arsenal’s Fábio Vieira scoring the clincher for last season’s Premier League runners-up.

question_sentence: Luton Town were promoted to the Premier League after beating which team in the Championship play-off final shoot-out?
evidence: Luton Town’s win means the team will return to the top division for the first time since 1992, a season before the Premier League was created.

question_sentence: What is the significance of the Baby Blue bobblehead being released by the University of Delaware?
choices: It celebrates National Bobblehead Day on Jan. 7
It commemorates the founding of the National Bobblehead Hall of Fame and Museum.
It honors Col. George W. YoUDee's bravery in battle during the Revolutionary War.

question_sentence: The RSPCA issued a warning about a rise in escapes by which increasingly popular exotic pets?
evidence: The RSPCA said calls to its snake hotline were at an all-time high, and warned of an expected increase in escapes over the summer as the reptiles become more active in hot weather. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which state was ordered by a federal judge this week to remove floating barriers on Rio Grande aimed at deterring migrants?
evidence: Texas was ordered to remove the migrant barriers in the Rio Grande by September 15. The buoys have been a contentious issue since they were deployed in the river as part of Gov. Greg Abbott’s border security initiative known as Operation Lone Star. A federal appeals court has since issued a stay allowing the barriers to remain for now.

question_sentence: In Ticketmaster's latest presale fiasco, fans of what comedian experienced problems, long waits and inflated prices?
Which tropical island faced deadly wildfires this week?
evidence: Dozens of people have died in Maui wildfires that overwhelmed hospitals, demolished homes and destroyed cultural sites.

question_sentence: Which Food Network show is Anne Burrell known for and what event did she host for Meals on Wheels in Delaware?
choices: "Iron Chef America"; She hosted a cooking competition for Meals on Wheels.
"Chopped"; She hosted a charity cooking event for Meals on Wheels.
"Worst Cooks in America"; She hosted the 20th annual Celebrity Chefs’ Brunch for Meals on Wheels.
"Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives"; She hosted a food festival for Meals on Wheels.

question_sentence: In which event did Britain’s Katarina Johnson-Thompson win gold at the 2023 World Athletics Championship?
evidence: Johnson-Thompson clinched her second World Championship title by running a personal best in the final 800-metre event on Sunday in Budapest. The victory marks a remarkable comeback for the 30-year-old, who suffered serious achilles tendon and calf injuries after winning gold in 2019.

question_sentence: What is the specialty drink at the Rail Haus German-style beer garden in Dover, Delaware?
The Met Gala took place this week in New York City, honoring which creative field?
evidence: The event is often referred to as “Fashion’s Biggest Night.” This year, the theme was “In honor of Karl,” a tribute to the late designer Karl Lagerfeld.

question_sentence: The EPA proposed ambitious car pollution rules this week. If approved, nearly 70% of all new-car sales in the US will be electric by which decade?
evidence: The rules would require electric vehicles to account for up to two-thirds of new cars sold in the US by 2032 in what would be one of the Biden administration’s most aggressive climate-change policies yet.

question_sentence: Michael van Gerwen has made Premier League Darts history by winning the tournament how many times?
evidence: The Dutch star beat Gerwyn Price 11-5 to win the Premier League Darts final at London’s 02 Arena on Thursday. Van Gerwen takes the titles record from six-times winner Phil Taylor.

question_sentence: What is creeping up the Mississippi River toward New Orleans that is sparking concern among officials?
evidence: A surge of saltwater is creeping up the Mississippi River toward New Orleans, threatening to pollute the drinking water of around 800,000 people.

question_sentence: Which American football team was left out of the 2023 College Football Playoffs despite being undefeated this season?
evidence: The College Football Playoff committee omitted the 13-0 Seminoles after the team's star quarterback suffered a season-ending injury. Critics including Florida's Governor Ron DeSantis have protested against the decision, which marks the first time in CFP's 10-year history that an undefeated major conference team has been left out.

question_sentence: Ten-time NBA All-Star Carmelo Anthony announced his retirement this week. He played for all of these teams, except:
Why did the Christina School District decide to move its graduation ceremonies from the University of Delaware?
choices: The University of Delaware increased its rental fees for the venue.
The University of Delaware refused to host the school district's graduations.
The Christina School District wanted to consolidate graduations into a single day.
The University of Delaware security staff is accused of mishandling a recent graduation event.

question_sentence: Which media company pushed back after Twitter designated its account as “state-affiliated media”?
Democratic Sen. Laphonza Butler made history this week when she became the only Black woman presently serving in the Senate. Which state does she represent?
evidence: Laphonza Butler was appointed to fill the late Sen. Dianne Feinstein’s Senate seat in California.

question_sentence: ESPN apologized for airing footage during the broadcast of a game between the Miami Heat and the New York Knicks that showed what?
Which political leader met with North Korea’s Kim Jong Un this week?
evidence: The leaders of Russia and North Korea met this week after US officials warned that the two countries are “actively advancing” in a potential arms deal.

question_sentence: Which toy will no longer be sold by Amazon, Target and Walmart due to safety concerns?
evidence: Major retailers have voluntarily stopped selling water beads marketed for children. Water beads are tiny balls made out of extremely absorbent polymer material that can expand up to 100 times their size when exposed to liquid. Health experts say they can cause intestinal blockages if injested.

question_sentence: The Mexican government is reviving a 100-year-old railway line in a bid to attract container traffic. Which bodies of water will the track connect?
choices: The Gulf of Mexico and the Pacific Ocean
The Caribbean Sea and the Gulf of Mexico
The Pacific Ocean and the South Atlantic Ocean
The Caribbean Sea and the Atlantic Ocean
evidence: The $2.8bn revival of the Tehuantepec Interoceanic Corridor could divert cargo traffic from the Panama Canal and provide a new route by which international freight could travel.

question_sentence: An off-duty Alaska Airlines pilot has been accused of trying to shut off a plane’s engines mid-flight. Which drug did he say he had consumed before the incident?
evidence: The pilot accused of attempting to disable a plane’s engines mid-flight told investigators he believed he was dreaming and had taken “magic mushrooms” about 48 hours before the incident, according to court documents. He has been charged with 83 felony counts of attempted murder.

question_sentence: Elon Musk has rebranded Twitter as what?
evidence: Musk announced this week that his company’s logo would change from the well-known blue bird to a black X. The billionaire’s controversial rebrand was widely ridiculed, with Forbes criticising him for “setting something on fire he paid $44 billion for”.

question_sentence: Locals in a Berlin suburb were told to stay indoors with their pets after reports that what was on the loose?
evidence: German authorities warned locals in Berlin’s southern suburbs to stay indoors after reports that a female lion was at large. Two witnesses reported seeing a big cat running after and killing a wild boar, according to public broadcaster RBB. “We don’t know where it came from,” said police spokesman Daniel Kiep. No nearby zoos, circuses or sanctuaries seem to be missing one.

question_sentence: The largest health care strike in US history began this week. Around how many hospital employees walked off the job?
evidence: More than 75,000 unionized employees of Kaiser Permanente — around 40% of its total staff — took to the picket lines this week to demand better pay and benefits.

question_sentence: Which countries will host matches in the unprecedented six-nation 2030 FIFA World Cup?
choices: Bulgaria, Romania, Serbia, Greece, Denmark and Finland
Morocco, Portugal, Spain, Uruguay, Argentina and Paraguay
France, Ireland, UK, Germany, Sweden and Italy
Mexico, Canada, Brazil, Chile, South Africa and Egypt
evidence: In a controversial selection of six joint World Cup hosts for 2030, the majority of matches will be played in Morocco, Portugal and Spain, while Uruguay, Argentina and Paraguay will hold the opening three games.

question_sentence: Which classic video game was finally beaten this week nearly 40 years after its release?
evidence: A 13-year-old from Oklahoma is believed to be the first human gamer to reach level 157 of Tetris. The winning moment is circulating online in a now viral YouTube video.

question_sentence: Which country was crowned the winner of Eurovision 2023?
evidence: Sweden’s Loreen won the Eurovision Song Contest for the second time. The singer, who won the competition in 2012, triumphed in Liverpool with pop-anthem “Tattoo”.

question_sentence: Which term was Google’s most-searched news trend in 2023?
evidence: Google’s top trending term in the US and globally was “War in Israel and Gaza,” the company announced Monday. Other leading topics included NFL player Damar Hamlin, the “Barbie” and “Oppenheimer” movies, and the late actor Matthew Perry.

question_sentence: According to latest Halifax data, UK house prices fell by how much year-on-year in August?
evidence: The drop is the biggest year-on-year decrease since 2009. Rival lender Nationwide last week put the drop at 5.3%, as homeowners and potential buyers face persistently high interest rates.

question_sentence: Harrison Ford has had a new species of which animal named after him?
evidence: Harrison Ford has had a species of Peruvian snake named after him – the Tachymenoides harrisonfordi – in honour of his environmental work as vice-chair of Conservation International. Ford’s legendary Indiana Jones character famously fears snakes, but the actor said he likes serpents and “found a quick kinship with this one”. For more stories from the stranger side of life, subscribe to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which route has been completely canceled by Avelo Airlines?
King Charles is facing criticism for appointing as head of the royal medical household a doctor who has advocated for what?
evidence: Dr Michael Dixon, "a champion of faith healing and herbalism", has "quietly" held the senior position for the last year, The Sunday Times reported last weekend. Dixon's duties include having overall responsibility for the health of the King and the wider royal family, and potentially even representing them in talks with government.

question_sentence: Cocaine use appears to be on the rise in the UK, based on an analysis of what?
evidence: According to an analysis of wastewater in several major cities, use of the Class A drug has risen by as much as a quarter in just one year, said the National Crime Agency. The agency said testing of wastewater gave a better indication of drug use than public surveys or estimates from seized substances. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Newly released Metropolitan Police figures show that one in every how many officers in the force are currently suspended or on restricted duties?
evidence: The Met has a total of around 34,000 officers, 201 of whom are suspended, while 860 are on restricted duties. The London force said that 450 officers were under investigation for alleged sexual or domestic violence, and that 275 were already awaiting gross misconduct hearings, amid a crackdown on rogue officers.

question_sentence: A beluga whale nicknamed Hvaldimir, who has reappeared this week, was accused of what when he was first spotted off the coast of Norway in 2019?
evidence: Hvaldimir has recently reappeared off the coast of Sweden, having spent years in Norwegian waters. When the whale first appeared four years ago, marine biologists from the Norwegian directorate of fisheries removed a harness, which had a mount suitable for an action camera and the words “Equipment St Petersburg” printed on it, leading to speculation the whale could have been part of a Russian spying programme.

question_sentence: A bicorne hat worn by Napoleon Bonaparte sold for how much at a Paris auction this week?
evidence: The faded black felt hat, which was valued between €600,000 and €800,000, was the centrepiece of an auction of the 19th century French emperor's belongings. The price surpassed the €1.8 million paid for another of his hats in 2014.

question_sentence: HBO Max relaunched this week as a service called:

Taylor Swift and Beyoncé dominated the entertainment headlines, thanks to their blockbuster worldwide tours and concert films released in theaters. Beyoncé also set a record for the most Grammy Awards. How many has she won?
evidence: Beyoncé has collected 32 Grammy Awards, and she made history thanks to her “Renaissance” album.

question_sentence: Judges in England and Wales were given the green light to use which online tool to help write legal rulings?
evidence: New guidance from the Judicial Office says that AI can be used to summarise large amounts of text or for administrative tasks. But judges were warned not to conduct legal research or analysis, as chatbots are prone to making up fictitious cases.

question_sentence: After six decades in the making, the FDA this week approved the first vaccine for which virus?
evidence: After a 60-year scientific quest, the world has its first vaccine to protect against respiratory syncytial virus, or RSV.

question_sentence: What is the federal minimum wage in the US?
evidence: Twenty states are still using the federal minimum wage of $7.25, which hasn’t gone up since 2009. Twenty-two states are raising their minimum wages on January 1.

question_sentence: Twitter’s famous blue bird logo has been replaced by what image in what is thought to be a late April Fool’s Day prank by billionaire owner Elon Musk?
evidence: On Monday, Twitter users noted that the blue bird logo usually found on Twitter’s homepage and loading screen has now been replaced with an image of Doge, the Shiba Inu dog used as a popular internet meme.

question_sentence: Parts of Florida’s Broward County are under quarantine after sightings of which invasive species?
evidence: Some neighborhoods in Broward County are under quarantine after sightings of invasive giant African land snails, which eat at least 500 different types of plants and can also chomp through stucco, plastic recycling bins and even signs.

question_sentence: The Indian government controversially decided to limit the export of what foodstuff?
evidence: India, which supplies about 40% of the world’s rice exports, took the unprecedented step of banning the export of non-basmati white rice, in an effort to curb domestic inflation. But the move is likely to push up prices all over the world.

question_sentence: Why did comedian Nikki Glaser spend $25,000 on Taylor Swift concert tickets this year?
choices: She wanted to break a record for attending the most concerts.
She was on tour with Taylor Swift.
She has a strong obsession with Taylor Swift's music.
She bought the tickets for her children.

question_sentence: What was the final score of the football game between Delaware and Penn State?
After premiering in July, “Barbie” became the highest-grossing movie at the US box office this year. Who directed this pink-hued blockbuster about the iconic doll?
evidence: Greta Gerwig directed “Barbie,” which stars Margot Robbie and Ryan Gosling and raked in more than $1.4 billion worldwide.

question_sentence: Taco Bell is trying to cancel which trademark held by Wyoming-based Taco John’s?
Scotland’s former first minister Alex Salmond turned down an invitation to which event?
choices: Service of Thanksgiving and Dedication for King Charles
evidence: Salmond snubbed what was dubbed the “Scottish coronation” of the new monarch and predicted that Charles would be the “last King of Scots”.

question_sentence: How many flights on private jets were made globally last year, according to a new report?
evidence: According to the think-tank report, the global fleet of private jets has more than doubled in the past two decades, hitting 23,133 in mid-2022, and sales are forecast to reach a record high of $34.6bn (£27.6bn) this year. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Which car company has publicly criticised Rishi Sunak’s decision to delay the UK’s 2030 ban on new petrol and diesel cars?
evidence: The company’s UK chair, Lisa Brankin, said the 2030 target had been a "vital catalyst to accelerate Ford into a cleaner future“. Pushing back the non-electric car ban to 2035 would “undermine” the government’s “ambition, commitment and consistency”, Brankin warned.

question_sentence: NASA this week announced the names of the astronauts who will be sent on a historic journey around the moon next year aboard the Artemis II rocket. How many astronauts were selected to join the mission?
evidence: Four astronauts, including three Americans and one Canadian, will be the first crew sent to orbit the moon since the Apollo program ended more than 50 years ago.

question_sentence: What sparked a police investigation at Carousel Park in Pike Creek, Delaware?
Prince William is launching a five-year project to tackle what social crisis?
evidence: Speaking to The Sunday Times, the Prince of Wales pledged to use the Royal Foundation to “end homelessness” in the UK, adding: “I’ve been waiting for the right time to do this.” Prince William was 11 when his mother took him to a homeless shelter in London – “a formative moment” for the young royal, said the paper.

question_sentence: What is the age limit for individuals to participate in virtual auditions for the upcoming season of "American Idol"?
Which MLB team won the World Series this week?
evidence: The Texas Rangers won their first World Series title in franchise history, defeating the Arizona Diamondbacks.

question_sentence: Colombia’s authorities are being urged to act against a growing population of which animal?
evidence: The so-called “cocaine hippos” are descendants of four brought to Colombia by late druglord Pablo Escobar. Warnings that they pose a serious threat to humans and other wildlife have intensified after a new census found that the invasive hippo population has expanded to up to 215.

question_sentence: Keir Starmer vowed to be bolder and “go beyond” which former Labour PM on public service reform?
evidence: In a newspaper interview ahead of Thursday’s local elections, Starmer pledged to lead a “bold and reforming Labour government bringing about real change” by overhauling public services including the NHS. The Labour leader also unveiled plans to help first-time home buyers, and a revamp of tuition fees.

question_sentence: What is the name of the 1,500-square-mile iceberg that is on the move after breaking away from Antarctica?
evidence: The iceberg, which is the largest in the world, had been stuck on the ocean floor of the Weddell Sea since breaking loose from the Antarctic shelf in 1986, but is now heading towards the Southern Ocean. Scientists say the trillion-ton berg is drifting at a rate of three miles a day, but why it is on the move is unclear.

question_sentence: The World Meteorological Organization has warned that the planet will breach the 1.5C global warming “threshold” by what year?
evidence: According to the World Meteorological Organization, there is now a greater likelihood that the planet will surpass a 1.5C increase in global warming by 2027. If this threshold is consistently exceeded, it would signify a heightened risk of reaching critical climate “tipping points”. Passing these tipping points would lead to a less hospitable planet and an acceleration of climate change.

question_sentence: How much did taxpayers reportedly pay per day for compensation payments to sacked employees during Liz Truss’s time in Downing Street?
evidence: Liz Truss’s brief reign reportedly cost taxpayers nearly £34,000 a day in compensation payments to sacked ministers, advisers and officials. Official data shows that special advisers were paid a total of £2.9 million in severance awards when their bosses were given the boot. Truss herself received £18,660 in severance pay, after her mini-budget sparked chaos in the financial markets.

question_sentence: What percentage of British teenagers feel "addicted" to social media, according to a new Cambridge University study?
evidence: An analysis of responses from 7,000 people aged 16-18 for the Millennium Cohort study found that a higher proportion of girls (57%) than  boys (37%)  agreed or strongly agreed with the statement "I think I am addicted to social media".

question_sentence: Twitter CEO Elon Musk replaced the company’s traditional bird icon this week with an image of which animal?
evidence: Twitter’s traditional bird icon was temporarily replaced with an image of a Shiba Inu dog, an apparent nod to dogecoin, the joke cryptocurrency that CEO Elon Musk is being sued over.

question_sentence: Pupils at an independent school in North London have voted to make what change to their lunches?
choices: New option to order fast food
Sixth-form pupils can have a glass of wine
evidence: North London Collegiate School will trial dishes such as Chinese-style noodles with teriyaki grasshopper, sweet chilli and lime crickets, and Mexican rice topped with buffalo worms.

question_sentence: US Rep. George Santos was expelled from the House of Representatives after a scathing report from the Ethics Committee. Which state is Santos from?
evidence: Santos, a Republican from New York, was accused of spending campaign money on personal expenses such as Botox and leisure travel.

question_sentence: What is the name of the Delaware roadside restaurant that Chris Taggart and Brian Kirwin acquired three years ago this December?
choices: The Charcoal Pit on Concord Pike
The Dog House at 200 N. Dupont Highway
Tom Jones Diner in Brookhaven, Pennsylvania
US Foods, an American food service distributor

question_sentence: Drive-in movies were a popular summer pastime in the ‘50s and ‘60s. When did the first drive-in movie theater open in the US?
evidence: The Camden Drive-In in Camden, New Jersey opened in June of 1933. The price of admission was 25 cents for the car and 25 cents per person.

question_sentence: What is the focus of Delaware State University's contribution to the Lunar Land Rover Mission funded by a $899,000 grant from NASA?
choices: Developing advanced propulsion systems for the rover
Designing and developing infrared sensing and laser technology for detecting water isotopes in lunar rocks and dust
Creating a communication system for the rover to transmit data back to Earth
Studying the impact of lunar dust on equipment and instruments

question_sentence: What action did ChristianaCare take regarding Humana Medicare Advantage plans in January 2024?
choices: ChristianaCare started accepting Humana Medicare Advantage plans as in-network.
ChristianaCare continued to accept Humana Medicare Advantage plans as in-network.
ChristianaCare stopped accepting Humana Medicare Advantage plans as in-network.
ChristianaCare made no changes to its policy regarding Humana Medicare Advantage plans.

question_sentence: Apple recently unveiled its most ambitious – and riskiest – new product in years. What is it called?
evidence: Apple introduced a “mixed reality” headset called Apple Vision Pro, a technology that overlays virtual images on live video of the real world. The company said it will be available early next year in the US.

question_sentence: What is the primary claim made by the attorney general in the lawsuit against Meta Platforms Inc.?
choices: Meta knowingly collected data from users without parental consent.
Knowingly designed and deployed harmful features to get kids hooked on social media.
Meta concealed the extent of the psychological and health harms suffered by young users.
Meta violated state consumer protection laws.

question_sentence: What is the name of Apple’s newly unveiled “mixed reality” headset?
evidence: Touted as the “most advanced personal electronic device ever”, the $3,499 (£2,800) headset blends digital content with the physical world.

question_sentence: People around the world showed their support for World Lupus Day by wearing which color?
evidence: Many people around the world wore purple on Wednesday in honor of World Lupus Day, a global annual event that calls attention to the mysterious disease impacting more than 5 million people in the US alone.

question_sentence: As Russia’s war in Ukraine raged, a mercenary group attempted an insurrection against President Vladimir Putin. The Wagner Group’s leader later died in a plane crash. What was his name?
evidence: Yevgeny Prigozhin was among 10 people killed in a plane crash several weeks after the Wagner Group’s uprising.

question_sentence: American consumers are finally seeing a dip in grocery prices, data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics shows. Which food item decreased the most in price from February to March?
evidence: Eggs had the most dramatic decrease, with a nearly 11% decline. This comes after egg prices soared in previous months primarily due to avian flu, which constrained supply.

question_sentence: Horror movie "Five Nights at Freddy's" broke box-office records by earning how much in its opening weekend?
evidence: The adaptation of the popular 2014 video game earned $78 million domestically and a further $52 million in other countries worldwide, despite getting poor reviews and being released simultaneously on the Peacock streaming service. According to makers Universal and Blumhouse, the movie broke a string of box-office records including the biggest Halloween weekend opening of all time.

question_sentence: What was the name of Helen Achenbach's famous restaurant near Smyrna, known for its early morning hours, hearty breakfast sandwiches, and an Elvis Presley memorabilia-filled dining room?
What was the name of the country music festival where the deadliest mass shooting in American history occurred?
What was one of the proposed solutions to address concerns about safety in New Castle County's parks?
choices: Increasing the number of park events
Enhancing the permitting process for overcrowded parks

question_sentence: What type of barbecue flavors does Mission BBQ offer at its locations?
Hurricane Idalia made landfall Wednesday in which state?
evidence: Idalia made landfall as a powerful Category 3 hurricane on Florida’s Gulf Coast, inflicting deadly storm surge and catastrophic winds not seen in that area in 125 years.

question_sentence: Where did the Pilgrims celebrate the first Thanksgiving?
evidence: The first Thanksgiving was observed in Plymouth, Massachusetts, in 1621. A good autumn harvest led the Pilgrims to hold a feast to give thanks that lasted for three days.

question_sentence: Which city is home to the best drinking spot anywhere, according to the latest World's 50 Best Bars list?
evidence: For the second consecutive year, Barcelona has found itself home to the No.1 bar in the world, according to the latest rankings. Cocktail bar Sips took the title from last year's winner Paradiso, which slipped to fourth place. For more Food & Drink news, sign up to our newsletter.

question_sentence: Which type of bright celestial display will be visible in parts of the Northern Hemisphere this weekend?
evidence: The annual Perseid meteor shower, one of nature’s most stunning light displays, will peak on August 12 and 13.

question_sentence: The latest data shows that abortion rates in Scotland increased by how much between 2021 and 2022?
evidence: The number of women aged 16 to 19 accessing abortions in Scotland in 2021-22 rose to its highest level since data was first published in 2013. Experts have said that social media misinformation and the cost-of-living crisis contributed to the record-high figures.

question_sentence: What was the reason behind the permanent suspension of Indian Motorcycle dealerships and Intellicar by the Delaware Division of Motor Vehicles?
choices: The businesses were found to be selling stolen vehicles.
The businesses were found to be involved in a money laundering scheme.
The businesses failed to submit title applications to the DMV for vehicles sold by the dealerships within 30 days, as required by statute.
The businesses were found to be involved in a drug trafficking operation.

question_sentence: Who is the new speaker of the US House of Representatives?
evidence: Following three weeks of infighting, the Republican-led House finally elected the little-known Louisiana congressman on Wednesday as the 56th speaker, replacing ousted California Republican Kevin McCarthy. Johnson, a close ally of Donald Trump, has acknowledged the challenges of his new office, stressing the need to "unify our membership and build consensus" across the GOP.

question_sentence: Which drink company is receiving criticism for allegedly marketing high-caffeine products to children?
evidence: This week, Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said the FDA should investigate the high caffeine content in Prime Energy drinks and the company’s marketing efforts toward children on social media.

question_sentence: Which major car company is recalling 143,000 of its SUVs due to an airbag issue?
evidence: Volkswagen is recalling 143,000 of its Atlas SUVs due to a “sporadic” issue detected in some passenger-side airbags that can switch the sensor off under certain conditions.

question_sentence: Which popular cooking ingredient is in trouble as extreme heat and drought push the industry into crisis?
evidence: Olive oil industry experts are warning of skyrocketing prices and potential shortages due to scorching temperatures threatening a bad olive harvest.

question_sentence: Which public figure filed paperwork this week to run for president in 2024?
evidence: Environmental lawyer and anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has filed paperwork to run for president in 2024 as a Democrat. The 69-year-old is the son of former New York senator, US attorney general and assassinated 1968 presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy and the nephew of the late President John F. Kennedy.

question_sentence: Which day this week marked the unofficial end of summer?
evidence: Labor Day on Monday marked the unofficial end of summer for many in the US — but forecasts show that July-like heat will continue building across several states in the coming weeks.

question_sentence: Activists from Just Stop Oil halted an opera performance at Glyndebourne by doing what?
evidence: Three Just Stop Oil protesters interrupted a performance on Thursday of Francis Poulenc’s “Dialogues des Carmélites” at the opera festival, in East Sussex. The performance restarted after a 20-minute delay following the removal of the activists, who were not arrested.
choices: Setting off a confetti bomb and blasting air horns
Loudly singing songs from “Phantom of the Opera”
Doing cartwheels across the stage while naked

question_sentence: Hundreds of officers this week were called to respond to two mass shootings in which state?
evidence: A shooting rampage took place Wednesday at a restaurant and a bowling alley in Lewiston, Maine. The violence added to a list of 565 mass shootings reported across the US this year, according to the Gun Violence Archive.

question_sentence: How much did “The Marvels” make at the box office in the film's opening weekend?
evidence: The superhero film, which reportedly cost $250 million to make, scored the lowest opening-weekend takings in the 15-year history of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. By comparison, 2019's “Captain Marvel” debuted with $153 million.

question_sentence: How many US presidents were born on July 4?
evidence: Calvin Coolidge was born in Plymouth, Vermont, on July 4, 1872

question_sentence: Which Republican presidential candidate said he plans to skip the second GOP primary debate in California?
evidence: Former President Donald Trump, who skipped the first Republican presidential primary debate, will also skip the second debate next Wednesday and instead will travel to Detroit to deliver a speech to union workers. Like the first debate, the other GOP candidates must meet certain donor and polling thresholds to make the debate stage.

question_sentence: In 1803, the US purchased the Louisiana Territory from which country?
evidence: The US purchased 828,000 square miles of land west of the Mississippi River from France for $15 million – doubling the size of the nation.

question_sentence: What is the purpose of the Smyrna School District’s referendum in 2024?
choices: To increase taxes for new school buildings
To prioritize the safety of students and staff, while facilitating necessary school expansion
To decrease the general operating expenses of the district

question_sentence: Police Scotland is facing a flood of complaints from officers over a new policy requiring them to do what?
evidence: The Scottish Police Federation, which represents police officers, has reported being “inundated with complaints” over the policy, which the force said was necessary so that staff could wear protective FFP3 masks that require users to be clean-shaven. Four officers are reportedly taking legal action in relation to the rule, due to come into effect on 29 May.

question_sentence: Chaos reigned in the US House of Representatives, which elected Kevin McCarthy as speaker after 15 rounds of voting and then ousted him nine months later. Who is the new speaker of the House?
evidence: US Rep. Mike Johnson, a Republican from Louisiana, was chosen as House speaker in October.

question_sentence: Which team won the Women’s World Cup?
evidence: Spain made history by beating England 1-0 to win the Women’s World Cup for the first time.

question_sentence: Watermelon is a popular summertime treat. About what percentage of a watermelon is water?
evidence: The average watermelon is about 92% water.

question_sentence: Millions of Americans were under flood alerts across the Northeast this week. Which state received almost two months of rain in two days?
evidence: More than 200 people have been rescued since Sunday in Vermont, where flooding has submerged homes and turned streets into rivers.

question_sentence: The US and which other country this week launched their largest joint military drills in decades in the South China Sea?
evidence: More than 17,600 military personnel are taking part in drills including live-fire exercises and a boat-sinking rocket assault, amid fears that China may be preparing to launch an offensive against Taiwan.

question_sentence: Which unlikely creature did Hollywood actor Goldie Hawn claim "touched my face"?
evidence: The Oscar winner said she was "paralysed" by witnessing "silver" alien beings with "three triangular-shaped heads". The star told the Apple Fitness+ podcast that one of the otherworldly creatures touched her during the encounter, while sleeping in a friend's car during her early years in California, and "it felt like the finger of God".

question_sentence: What is another name often used to refer to Juneteenth?
evidence: Juneteenth is also referred to as Freedom Day, along with Emancipation Day and Jubilee Day.

question_sentence: Amazon is growing its footprint in the health sector. Which service did the e-commerce giant launch nationwide this week?
evidence: Amazon’s virtual clinic is now offering telehealth appointments in all 50 states and Washington, DC, the company announced on Tuesday. Amazon previously launched its own digital drugstore, Amazon Pharmacy, in 2020.

question_sentence: Which automaker recalled more than 112,000 vehicles this week due to a roll-away risk?
evidence: Ford is recalling more than 112,000 F-150 pickup trucks because of a potential axel issue that can be a roll-away risk.

question_sentence: True or false: LIV golfers are allowed to compete at this week’s Masters Tournament.
What is the name of the storm that pummelled Britain this week?
evidence: The first named storm to hit the UK in 2024 brought winds of up to 94mh and caused widespread flooding and travel disruption. Henk was the eighth named storm in three months and came days after Storm Gerrit ripped through the country.

question_sentence: Which former president scored an Emmy this week for outstanding narration?
evidence: Former President Barack Obama won a Creative Arts Emmy for outstanding narrator for his Netflix documentary series, “Working: What We Do All Day.”

question_sentence: What is the primary reason for the endangered status of crowned lemurs?
Which two sports entities announced a stunning merger this week?
What will be the leading cause of cancer in women under 60 by 2030, according to a new study?
evidence: According to forecasts by Cancer Research UK, obesity will overtake smoking as the leading cause of cancer among women under 60 by 2030. The UK is "reaping the consequences" of a government failure to tackle rising rates of people being overweight and obese, said Katharine Jenner, director of the Obesity Health Alliance.

question_sentence: Which state is asking for help in redesigning its flag?
evidence: Minnesota has received more than 2,600 design submissions for its new state flag. The change comes as the current Minnesota state flag has long drawn criticism for both its design and its depiction of Indigenous Americans.

question_sentence: Which airline this week said it will begin weighing some passengers before they board the airplane?
evidence: Some international travelers leaving Auckland International Airport will soon be asked to step on the scale to help gather data on the weight load and distribution for Air New Zealand planes, the airline said.

question_sentence: As Starbucks evaluates its environmental footprint, which product is the company trying to phase out?
evidence: Starbucks is inviting customers to use personal cups for nearly all orders, saying it will help reduce the company’s waste output.

question_sentence: Crews are cleaning up debris in the aftermath of Hurricane Hilary. Which state was badly damaged by the storm?
evidence: Hilary unleashed torrential rainfall and strong winds across portions of the southwestern US and Mexico. However, California was especially impacted by damaging floods and mudslides as the storm shuttered schools and closed businesses in the region.

question_sentence: What was the original purpose of the Baal statue that stood near the Smyrna Rest Area in Delaware?
The longest-ever strike by Hollywood actors ended after how many days?
evidence: The SAG-AFTRA union, which represents more than 60,000 Hollywood actors, announced on Wednesday that the four-month strike was ending, after agreeing a tentative deal with studios and streaming companies.The proposed agreement would give actors larger minimum-pay increases, a streaming bonus and "consent and compensation" provisions against AI.

question_sentence: One lucky lottery ticket for the $1.73 billion Powerball jackpot was sold this week in which state?
evidence: A ticket sold in California officially scored the second-largest jackpot in Powerball and US lottery history.

question_sentence: True or false: Brooks Koepka became the first LIV golfer to win a major title after winning the PGA Championship this week.
How many terms did George Washington serve as president of the US?
evidence: Washington considered retirement after one term, but associates implored him to serve an additional four years in the face of emerging political divisions that many feared would pull the young country apart.

question_sentence: What is the name of the anthem composed by Andrew Lloyd Webber for the King’s coronation?
evidence: The composer’s coronation anthem will be played publicly for the first time as King Charles III is crowned in Westminster Abbey on Saturday.  According to Lloyd Webber, the monarch requested that the tune be “hummable” and cheerful because “he wants the anthem sung in churches”.

question_sentence: Which football team showed significant improvement since moving to the Class 1A, potentially positioning them to contend for a state title?
Which two breweries in the Newark area of Delaware were named among the best Belgian-style brewers in the country at the Great American Beer Festival?
choices: Iron Hill Brewery & Musings Fermentation Underground
Autumn Arch Beer Project & Musings Fermentation Underground
Dogfish Head Craft Brewery & 3rd Wave Brewing Co.
16 Mile Brewing Company & Big Oyster Brewery

question_sentence: Manufacturer Reckitt Benckiser recalled which product from sale this week over contamination fears?
evidence: Reckitt Benckiser said it was voluntarily recalling 675,000 cans of Nutramigen Powder, a hypoallergenic formula sold in the US and UK, as a "precautionary step" owing to a "possibility of contamination" with Cronobacter sakazakii. The bacteria can cause the potentially fatal infections sepsis and meningitis, but the company said that no "illnesses or adverse events" linked to the products had been reported.

question_sentence: Two streaming services, HBO Max and Discovery+, are merging and rebranding as one mega service. What will it be called?
Apple on Tuesday unveiled its iPhone 15 lineup. Which current iPhone feature will be significantly altered in the new version?
evidence: Apple retired its Lightning charger on Tuesday, exactly 11 years to the day from when it was first announced, marking a milestone for the company by adopting universal charging.

question_sentence: A revised red, white and blue flag honoring Juneteenth was introduced in 2000. What symbol is at the center of the flag?
evidence: The flag, created by activist Ben Haith, founder of the National Juneteenth Celebration Foundation, has a white star in the middle representing the Lone Star State of Texas as well as the freedom of African Americans in all 50 states.

question_sentence: Disney's live-action adaptation of "The Little Mermaid" hits theaters this week. When was the classic animated version released?
Which author won the 2023 Booker Prize?
evidence: Announced at a ceremony in London on Sunday, this year's Booker Prize winner is among four Irish writers who made the 13-strong longlist. Commentators claimed that Lynch's victory confirms we are in what Sebastian Barry, the laureate for Irish fiction, has called a "golden age of Irish prose writing".

question_sentence: What traffic charge was the man, Johnathan Guessford, cited for after giving state police officers the middle finger in a confrontation?
choices: An improper hand gesture associated with non-motorized vehicles

question_sentence: How many of the six planned central towers on Barcelona's unfinished Sagrada Familia cathedral have now been completed?
evidence: This week saw the installation of the final sculptural piece on the tower of Matthew the Evangelist, followed by the crowning of the tower of John the Evangelist with the figure of an eagle. The Junta Constructora del Temple Expiatori de la Sagrada Família, which oversees the church's construction, is aiming to complete the planned central tower, which will represent Jesus, by 2026 – 144 years after building began.

question_sentence: Which public figure is gearing up to launch a 2024 presidential campaign in a matter of days?
evidence: Former Vice President Mike Pence will launch his 2024 presidential campaign on June 7 with an announcement video and a speech in Iowa, two sources familiar with the plans tell CNN.

question_sentence: Summer is also state fair season. Which state fair is the largest in the US?
evidence: In 2022, the State Fair of Texas welcomed more than 2.5 million visitors through its gates.

question_sentence: One of America’s most well-known Christmas trees toppled over in gusty winds this week. Where did this occur?
evidence: The 40-foot National Christmas tree in Washington, DC, was knocked down by high winds on Tuesday. It was later righted.

question_sentence: Which university was recently fined over $37 million by the Biden administration for misrepresenting the cost of its doctoral programs?
evidence: The Biden administration issued a $37.7 million fine against Grand Canyon University Tuesday after a Department of Education investigation concluded that the private school in Phoenix misrepresented the cost of its doctoral degree programs.

question_sentence: Which supermarket has been named Britain’s cheapest for a 12th consecutive month?
evidence: Latest research by Which? found that Aldi has remained the cheapest supermarket since May 2022, with an average basket of goods costing £68.60 last month. Lidl was just behind at £70.51, while Waitrose was the most expensive, at £86.91.

question_sentence: Which pro sports league announced it will play a game in Brazil during the 2024 season?
evidence: The National Football League (NFL) announced that São Paulo, Brazil, will host a regular-season game next year, the first ever in South America.

question_sentence: Which tech leader met with Israel’s president this week?
evidence: Elon Musk visited Israel Monday, meeting the country’s leaders as he tried to calm the outrage caused by his endorsement of an antisemitic post on his social media platform, X.

question_sentence: Why did ShopRite stores in Delaware return to full-service checkout with cashiers?
choices: Because they wanted to speed up the checkout process.
Because they experienced a labor shortage.

question_sentence: Eight Republican presidential candidates faced off Wednesday in the first primary debate of the 2024 campaign. Where did the debate take place?
evidence: The debate took place in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. The city will also be the site of the 2024 Republican National Convention, where the party will select its next presidential nominee.

question_sentence: Which sports brand faced a backlash after claiming its £45 trainers for babies "help promote natural foot development"?
evidence: The sports giant claims its Swoosh 1 trainers "can help promote natural foot development", but experts said "the necessity of wearing trainers is questionable" for babies. For more stories from the stranger side of life, subscribe to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Hollywood actors and writers went on strike, bringing most film and TV productions to a standstill for several months before they agreed on new contracts. Who leads SAG-AFTRA, the union for actors?
evidence: Fran Drescher is president of the Screen Actors Guild – American Federation of Television and Radio Artists.

question_sentence: Which company said it will begin deleting accounts that have been inactive for at least two years?
evidence: Google this week is beginning to delete inactive accounts to prevent security risks.

question_sentence: Which Delaware State University alumnus, now playing for the Colorado Buffaloes, could see extra playing time in the upcoming game against USC due to his strong performance despite limited playing time in the previous game against Oregon?
Uber released its annual list of items forgotten by passengers in cars. Which city took the top spot for being the most forgetful?
evidence: Jacksonville, Florida, had the most forgotten items, including phones, wallets, keys, jewelry and headphones, according to Uber’s report. San Antonio, Texas, and Palm Springs, California, took the second and third spots, respectively.

question_sentence: How did Danelo Souza Cavalcante escape from the Chester County prison?
choices: By scaling a wall of the exercise yard and running across the roof

question_sentence: The total number of women on this year’s Booker Prize shortlist is fewer than the tally of male nominees who share which first name?
evidence: Paul Harding, Paul Lynch and Paul Murray are among six authors nominated for Britain’s top literary prize. Jonathan Escoffery is also a finalist, with only two women on the shortlist, Sarah Bernstein and Chetna Maroo.

question_sentence: US gas prices hit 10-month highs this week at an average of $3.88 a gallon nationally on Thursday. How many states are already paying an average of $4 or more for gas?
evidence: As of Thursday, drivers in 12 states plus Washington, DC, were paying an average of $4 or more for gas, including Colorado, Arizona and Illinois, according to AAA. Indiana, Pennsylvania and New York aren’t far behind.

question_sentence: Racism, sexism, elitism and classism is prevalent at every level in which English sport, according to a new independent report?
evidence: A two-year investigation by the Independent Commission for Equity in Cricket found that racism was “entrenched” in the “elitist and exclusionary” sport, while women were “frequently demeaned, stereotyped and treated as second-class”.

question_sentence: Which country’s soccer team claimed the Women’s World Cup, hosted jointly this year by Australia and New Zealand?
evidence: Spain won its first Women’s World Cup, beating England 1-0 thanks to a goal from Olga Carmona.

question_sentence: How many times had a US House of Representatives speaker been removed from the role prior to the ousting of Kevin McCarthy?
evidence: McCarthy made history on Tuesday by becoming the first House speaker to be voted out of the job, following a revolt by members of his own Republican Party, including Donald Trump. Florida congressman Matt Gaetz spearheaded the rebellion after McCarthy relied on Democratic votes to get a short-term spending deal passed to avert a government shutdown.

question_sentence: The UK government has given a contract to a travel firm from which country for its planned asylum-seeker housing barges?
evidence: News broke this week that the government handed a £1.6 billion contract to  Australian firm Corporate Travel Management to cover three offshore asylum-seeker vessels. The government claimed the “floatels” would be “significantly cheaper” than housing arrivals in hotels.

question_sentence: According to reports, which MLB team signed a binding purchase agreement for 49 acres of land near the Las Vegas Strip?
Why are Dolly Parton's "Rockstar" movie tickets cheaper in Delaware compared to cities in surrounding states?
choices: Delaware has a special discount for Dolly Parton fans.
Delaware has lower movie ticket prices in general.
Dolly Parton visited Delaware last year and wanted to show appreciation to the state.

question_sentence: What was the total value of 180,000 cannabis plants seized by police in recent raids across England and Wales?
evidence: Police arrested almost 1,000 people in the UK’s largest ever crackdown on organised crime. A total of 20 firearms, £636,000 in cash and 20kg of cocaine were also seized during the nationwide raids in June, the National Police Chiefs’ Council announced this week.

question_sentence: An FDA panel unanimously recommended making a drug known as Opill available over the counter. What type of medication is it?
What is the primary goal of the "safe surrender" event being held at the Kent County Courthouse in Dover, Delaware?
choices: To offer amnesty to all individuals with outstanding warrants
To provide financial assistance to those who cannot pay fines
To bring together various parties in one place to resolve warrants and capiases
To apprehend and detain individuals with outstanding warrants

question_sentence: Who was criticised for saying Brits need to accept being “worse off” financially?
evidence: The Bank of England’s chief economist faced a fierce backlash after telling a podcast that UK households and companies need to “stop trying to maintain their real spending power by bidding up prices whether through higher wages or passing energy costs on to customers”.

question_sentence: Which type of product received a sweeping recall this week over concerns of fire and burn hazards?
evidence: Chinese home appliance manufacturer Gree is recalling 1.5 million dehumidifiers following reports of 23 units catching on fire, the US Consumer Product Safety Commission said.

question_sentence: Former Smyrna detective Michael Kealty is facing federal charges for distributing and possessing child pornography. What potential penalties could he face if convicted of distributing child pornography?
Which islands were at the centre of a diplomat spat this week between the EU and the UK?
evidence: A row broke out after the bloc referred to the Falkland Islands by the Argentine name, “Islas Malvinas”, in a communiqué signed in Brussels by 60 EU and Latin American nations. Rishi Sunak criticised the “regrettable choice of words”, which apparently endorsed Argentina’s claim to the archipelago, a British overseas territory.

question_sentence: A new vaccine became available this week for which virus?
evidence: A new Covid-19 vaccine is available — and recommended — for everyone ages 6 months and older, and experts say it’s best to take advantage of the protection it provides sooner rather than later.

question_sentence: Which organization was recently impacted by a cyberattack affecting its unclassified websites?
evidence: NATO says it is “actively addressing incidents” affecting its unclassified websites after a hacking group claimed to have stolen numerous strategic planning and research documents from the alliance.

question_sentence: US food giant Tyson Foods recalled 30,000lb (13,600kg) of which product over contamination fears?
evidence: Tyson, the largest US meat producer by sales, announced the voluntary recall last weekend after some consumers reported finding small pieces of metal in the "Fun Nuggets". The US Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) said it had received one report of a "minor oral injury" related to the consumption of the chicken patties.

question_sentence: This year’s Super Bowl marked the first time that two brothers faced off against each other in the big game. Which NFL teams do Travis Kelce and Jason Kelce play for?
evidence: Travis Kelce plays tight end for the Chiefs and Jason Kelce is a center for the Eagles. Kansas City beat Philadelphia 38-35 in Super Bowl LVII.

question_sentence: The Italian town of Portofino is banning tourists from doing what?
choices: Taking alcoholic drinks into the sea
evidence: The Italian Riviera town is introducing fines of up to €275 for loitering in designated no-waiting zones, in a bid to prevent street blockages caused by tourists taking snaps and selfies.

question_sentence: Which one of these Star Wars movies celebrated its 40th anniversary this week?
Thousands of people were evacuated from the Icelandic town of Grindavik amid fears of an eruption by which volcano?
evidence: Iceland has recorded hundreds of small earthquakes this week, with tens of thousands of tremors reported in the southwest region of Reykjanes. Scientists warned of a "high" chance that the tremors could disrupt the volcano, which is about 12 miles north of Grindavik.

question_sentence: What type of diet did Bradie Crandall adopt, which goes against the traditional notion of a protein-rich diet for muscle-building exercises?
Oddly enough, preparations are underway for a cage fight between Elon Musk and which other billionaire?
evidence: The cage match between billionaires Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg does not yet have a scheduled date, but according to Musk, it will be streamed on X, formerly known as Twitter.

question_sentence: McDonald’s announced a birthday meal, available beginning June 12, for which character?
An activist is to be prosecuted for contempt of court for holding up a sign outside the trial of protesters from which climate group?
evidence: Civil liberties campaigners said the decision to prosecute retired social worker Trudi Warner for holding up a sign allegedly directed at jurors was part of the government's crackdown on the right to protest. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: How many stars were on the first US flag?
evidence: There were 13 stars and 13 stripes on the first US flag to represent the 13 original states, as declared in the Flag Resolution of June 14, 1777 – a day now known as Flag Day.

question_sentence: Cybercriminals demanded £600,000 for data stolen during a ransomware attack on which UK institution?
evidence: Ransomware group Rhysida is demanding 20 bitcoin (about £600,000) for internal data stolen from the world's biggest library during a cyberattack. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: British Vogue editor-in-chief Edward Enninful will be replaced by who after stepping down next year?
evidence: Following months of speculation, Condé Nast has confirmed that London-born Nnadi, currently editor of the US Vogue website, will take the reins of the UK magazine from next March. The 44-year-old will be the publication’s first black female editor.

question_sentence: One of the longest hot weather streaks in US history finally ended this week. Which city saw temperatures over 110 degrees for 31 consecutive days?
evidence: Phoenix just endured the hottest month for any US city on record. Temperatures in the region peaked under 110 degrees Fahrenheit for the first time in a month on Monday.

question_sentence: Which scandal-plagued US politician was hit with 10 new criminal charges this week including wire fraud and identity theft?
evidence: The New York congressman pleaded not guilty in May to 13 criminal counts for various alleged campaign violations, including theft of public funds, money laundering, and lying on federal disclosure forms. Federal prosecutors this week hit the Republican with additional charges relating to allegedly stealing donors' identities and charging thousands of dollars to their credit cards.

question_sentence: Secretary of State Antony Blinken traveled to which country this week in an effort to “stabilize” relations?
evidence: Blinken traveled to China for meetings with top officials, including President Xi Jinping. Blinken is the first US secretary of state to visit Beijing in five years, and his talks were seen as a key litmus test for whether the two governments can stop relations from continuing to deteriorate at a time of lingering distrust.

question_sentence: Which country is moving forward with its controversial plan to release radioactive water into the ocean?
evidence: Japan will soon begin releasing radioactive water from the Fukushima nuclear plant into the ocean as space runs out to contain the contaminated material. Japan’s government said the treated water will be highly diluted and safely released slowly over decades. But some experts and residents are concerned that diluting the water might not be enough to reduce its impact on marine life and local communities.

question_sentence: In which city did Vladimir Putin confirm that he will run for re-election next year?
evidence: Putin ended months of speculation when he confirmed his bid for another six-year term as president, during a military awards ceremony at the Kremlin. His expected victory in elections scheduled to take place in March paves the way for him to remain in power until 2036 – by which point he would have surpassed Joseph Stalin's 29 years to become Russia's longest-serving leader.

question_sentence: Proposals for enforcing the UK's Online Safety Act include the mandatory use of facial age estimation technology to check users of what?
evidence: Draft rules from regulator Ofcom would require porn sites to ensure users are over 18 by using age-checking measures including face scans, photo-ID documents and credit card checks. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: South Africa holds a total of how many Rugby World Cup titles after beating New Zealand in this year's tournament final?
evidence: The Springboks now hold the record for Rugby World Cup title wins following their 12-11 victory in last Saturday's final in Paris. Arch-rivals New Zealand have won the tournament three times.

question_sentence: Dominion Voting Systems settled with which TV network in a defamation lawsuit over the broadcast of lies after the 2020 presidential election?
What caused a 70-vehicle crash in Illinois this week?
evidence: At least six people were killed Monday when a dust storm in Illinois suddenly made it nearly impossible to see on the short stretch of highway, officials said.

question_sentence: How many Peloton bikes were recalled this week over a potential safety hazard?
evidence: The US Consumer Product Safety Commission recalled 2 million Peloton bikes due to a safety hazard caused by the adjustable seat that could break during use and injure the rider.

question_sentence: The US made a deal with which country to free five wrongfully detained Americans?
evidence: Five Americans were released from Iranian detention in a wider deal to unfreeze $6 billion in Iranian funds.

question_sentence: Football legend Eric Cantona performed the first concert of his singer-songwriter career last weekend. In which French city did it take place?
evidence: The former Manchester United striker, who began his football career in the Burgundy town of Auxerre, performed a two-hour set that won the critics over, with Le Parisien newspaper comparing Cantona’s music to Leonard Cohen and Nick Cave.

question_sentence: Japan has infuriated neighbours with its plans to release what into the ocean?
evidence: Ever since the 2011 tsunami destroyed the Fukushima nuclear plant, Japan has been pumping water into the site to cool the reactor’s fuel rods – contaminating 130,000 litres a day. Now, the government plans to release a million metric tons of this treated radioactive water into the ocean, “enough to fill 500 Olympic-size swimming pools”, to intense opposition from China and many Pacific islands.

question_sentence: The Commons standards committee this week recommended suspending which MP?
evidence: The MP for Tamworth faces an eight-week suspension following a Standards Committee report into sexual assault allegations. The recommendation could trigger a recall petition in Pincher’s constituency, paving the way for a by-election.

question_sentence: Rose Zhang won the Mizuho Americas Open on Sunday, becoming the first golfer to win on the LPGA tour in her debut since:
What is the primary focus of the Brandywine River Restoration Trust's mission?
choices: Promoting local sources of water and tap water
Cleaning up water in the Brandywine and educating underserved communities about contaminated water
Analyzing rainfall data for real-time updates on river water quality

question_sentence: Amid soaring inflation, what generation has been using cash as a budgeting tool more than all other generations?
Which would-be Republican presidential nominee referred to the absent Donald Trump as "Donald Duck" during the second GOP debate?
evidence: Trump, who continues to lead the 2024 polls, skipped Wednesday's debate in California and instead delivered a speech in Michigan. The remaining candidates battled it out at the Ronald Reagan presidential library in Simi Valley, California, with former New Jersey governor calling Trump "afraid" over his absence.

question_sentence: A recent letter from the Vatican appears to show Pope Francis may consider opening the door to blessing same-sex couples. Where is Vatican City located?
evidence: Pope Francis, the head of the Catholic Church in Vatican City, Italy, has suggested for the first time that some people in same-sex unions could be blessed by Catholic priests on a “case-by-case” basis. It is a reversal of previous statements in which the Pope said the Church could not bless same-sex unions, because they could “not bless sin.”

question_sentence: President Joe Biden welcomed which world leader to the White House for a state dinner this week?
evidence: Biden hosted Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the White House on Thursday for a lavish, tented state dinner that featured a plant-based menu for the guest of honor, who is a vegetarian.

question_sentence: The U.S. Senate confirmed confirmed historian and political scientist Colleen Shogan to head which federal agency?
Scientists from which country claimed to have discovered the world’s first room-temperature superconductor?
evidence: A research team from Seoul, South Korea, caused a global stir by claiming to have discovered a compound that can operate as a superconductor at room temperature, a finding that would have almost incalculable value. But the scientific community at large remains deeply sceptical and has thus far failed to reproduce the results.

question_sentence: Who was named People’s Sexiest Man Alive of 2023?
evidence: The 57-year-old “Grey’s Anatomy” star said he was "glad it's happening at this point in my life", after being unveiled by People as this year's winner. Dempsey is the magazine's first Sexiest Man Alive since 2019 who isn't part of the Marvel Universe, with Chris Evans, Paul Rudd and Michael B. Jordan claiming the title over the past three years.

question_sentence: The Supreme Court blocked the Biden administration’s student loan forgiveness plan that aimed to deliver up to $20,000 of relief to millions of borrowers. How many Supreme Court justices ruled against the program?
evidence: The decision was 6-3 with Chief Justice John Roberts writing the opinion for the conservative supermajority. The three liberal dissenters — Justices Elena Kagan, Sonia Sotomayor, and Ketanji Brown Jackson — said the majority is basically making political decisions.

question_sentence: The contents of which late music star’s former home are being put up for sale?
evidence: Around 1,500 items belonging to the former Queen frontman – including his Tiffany & Co moustache comb and a silk waistcoat decorated with cats – will be displayed at Sotheby’s London from 4 August until 5 September, and will then go under the hammer.

question_sentence: Latest polling suggests that Labour and the Tories are "neck and neck" in the upcoming by-election in which constituency?
evidence: The Survation poll, commissioned by the Labour Together group, found that the Labour and Conservative candidates for the previously safe Tory seat were level-pegging on 29% each. But pundits said that with the Lib Dems candidate on 22%, a split “progressive” vote could spell victory for the Tories in the October by-election, which was triggered by the resignation of Nadine Dorries.
